excerpt: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 3.XPubliée le 2025-03-17ComparerSDK (Core) for C# [3.7.0] - 2026-01-16 Added Administration service: SetExternalPresenceAsync(), GetExternalPresenceAsync() and Remove
content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 3.XPubliée le 2025-03-17ComparerSDK (Core) for C# [3.7.0] - 2026-01-16 Added Administration service: SetExternalPresenceAsync(), GetExternalPresenceAsync() and RemoveExternalPresenceAsync() methods to manage "external presence" Application service: Add optional parameter logoutUrl in LoginWithTokenAsync(), LoginWithTokenWithoutEventPipeAsync(), LoginWithTokenAsync() and LoginWithTokenWithoutEventPipeAsync() methods UserCredentials object: add LogoutUrl and ApplicationToken properties Bubbles service: AutoClearBubbleContentAsync(), ClearBubbleContentAsync() methods ConferenceDetails object: ContentToAutoClear property BubbleAffiliation object: Reason property - possible values: "deactivated", "resumed" or empty Contacts service: CustomStatusUpdated event, CreateCustomStatus(), UpdateCustomStatusAsync(), DeleteCustomStatusAsync() and GetCustomStatusesAsync() methods to manage custom statuses FileStorage service: AddViewerAsync(), RemoveViewerAsync() and GetFileDescriptorSync() methods InstantMessaging service: ForwardMessageAsync() method: add optional parameter anonymously (True by default) Message object: add ForwardedFromContact property Peer object: IsChannel(), IsChannelWithId(), IsChannelWithJid(), IsChannelWithIdAndJid(), static methods IsEntity(), IsEntityWithId(), IsEntityWithJid(), IsEntityWithIdAndJid(), static methods Fixed Application service: if used, ensure to check Turn Servers configuration based on theirs TTL Bubble service: join automatically a bubble which is no more inactive avoid to trigger several times same BubbbleAffiliationChanged event Conferences service: Before to start a conference, ensure to set as active the associated bubble if necessary Contacts service: about presence correctly manage away versus away inactive states FileStorage service: avoid to trigger several times same FileStorageUpdated event InstantMessaging service: Store message in cache only if StorageMode is set to Store Avoid to store message sent with <CDATA> section Mark automatically message as read (if specified) only if StorageMode is Store or NoPermanentStore When forwarding a message with a file, ensure to set the receiver as viewer of this file Before to send a message to a bubble, ensure to set it as active if necessary Removed ConferenceDetails object: Breaking Scheduled, ScheduledStartDate , ScheduledEndDate , ScheduledDuration , MediaType , LastUpdateDate, Sessions properties Breaking ConferenceSession object:: [3.6.0] - 2025-11-20 Info New RPC service (Remote Procedure Call) As client permits to request RPC method of a Peer and get the result As server permits to add / remove new RPC method: possibility to restrict access according RPC method and / or Peer It's possible to be client and server in same time Interaction between CPaaS Rainbow client (Web Client, Desktop Client) and SDK CPaaS client offers default RPC Methods (make call for example) which can be requested from SDK CPaaS client can request SDK RPC Methods using custom manifest file Guest updates: Can no more be created using CreateGuestUserAsync() and CreateAnonymousGuestUserAsync() in Administration service Contacts with GuestMode still exist which are created using Bubble Link: see CreateUserWithBubbleLinkAsync() in Administration service Fixed Jingle service: add more tests when sendinq Iq (to avoid use of null value for jid or resource) Added Added .Net 10.0 as target framework Alerts service: RemoveDevicesTagsAsync(), RenameDevicesTagsAsync() and GetDevicesTagsStatisticsAsync() methods AlertFilter object with new field IpAddresses AlertDevicesTagCount, AlertDevicesTagsStatistics, AlertFilterIpAddresses and AlertFilterIpAddresseRange objects Contacts service: IsCompanyAdminAsync() and IsCompanyAdminSync() methods FileStorage service: CreateArchiveAsync() method QuotaConsumption object: add Recordings and Others properties InstantMessaging service: PrivateMessageReceived event SendPrivateMessageAsync(), AnswerToPrivateMessageAsync() methods Message object with new field PrivateMessage JSONNode object: Escape() method Peer object: IsContactWithIdAndJid(), IsBubbleWithIdAndJid() methods Restrictions object: UseRPC property (false by default) RPC service: CallMethodAsync(), ListMethodsAsync(), GetMethodHelpAsync(), GetMethodSignaturesAsync(), RestRequestAsync() methods (for RPC client) AddMethod(), RemoveMethod(), DefineDelegateToAllowRPCRequests(), AllowAllRPCRequests() methods and AllowRestRequestAsRpcMethod property (for RPC server) Base64, RPCRestRequest, RPCRestResponse objects SdkInternalErrorEnum enum: XMPP_IQ_ERROR, XMPP_IQ_TIMEOUT: to provide more error details in IQ context RPC_PARSING_ERROR_METHODCALL_NODE, RPC_PARSING_ERROR_VALUE_NODE_TO_OBJECT, RPC_PARSING_ERROR_OBJECT_TO_VALUE_NODE, RPC_NO_METHOD_FOUND, RPC_NO_METHOD_FOUND_WITH_CORRECT_SIGNATURE, RPC_EXCEPTION_IN_METHOD, RPC_PARSING_METHOD_RESULT, RPC_UNEXPECTED_ERROR, RPC_NOT_ALLOWED Util object: XmlEncode() and XmlDecode() methods Changed C

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationData in cacheLTS release 3.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Data storage and connection / reconnection Prerequisite You must first know how to connect and manage auto-reconnection service using the
content: DocumentationData in cacheLTS release 3.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Data storage and connection / reconnection Prerequisite You must first know how to connect and manage auto-reconnection service using the SDK: Connect to Rainbow. Auto Reconnection. Introduction The SDK cannot retrieve all data "at once" once connected to the server. In addition, this connection can be interrupted and the data must be synchronized again. This guide aims: To list what data is stored To understand when they are available they depend on the user's license they depend on the options used in the SDK To understand the connection and reconnection problem to synchronize this data The last chapter, via code example, shows how to handle all of this. Connection / Reconnection (REST and Event Pipe) The SDK is connected to the Rainbow server using two different channels: REST API (HTTP requests): asynchonous connection based on secutiry token with a "time to live" XMPP (or eventually S2S) event pipe: web socket connection which needs permanent connection. From a global point of view, REST API is used for static data and event pipe for dynamic data (presence, instant messaging, ...) To be fully operational, the SDK must create a valid link on both channels (authenticated, connected) and have enough data/information (license, settings, ...) after connection or a reconnection. As developper, you only know if the SDK is connected or not using event ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service but you cannot know which one specificalyy is connected/disconnected. To give more details, event pipe disconnection occurs more often. For example, if there is a network trouble for a short period, the event pipe will be disconnected but not the REST API channel. And usually, if the REST API channel is disconnected, the event pipe is also disconnected. Bubbles and how they are managed To receive or send messages or to get dynamic information about a Bubble (for example that there is a conference in progress), the SDK must first join it. It also called a bubble affiliation. The SDK can do it: only when the event pipe connection is operational and join Bubbles one by one. So, the more bubbles you have, the longer it takes to join them all. Contacts presence To know the Aggregated Presence (also called Unified Ptesence) of one contact, the SDK must first receive information of each of his devices: One for each client used: Rainbow Web client, Rainbow Mobile Phone (Adnroid and/or iOS, ...) Optionnaly, one to manage his telephony device (Rainbow Hub or OXO/OXE) Optionnaly, one to manage his calendar presence (Google Calendar, Office 365, ...) Optionnaly, one to manage his Team presence (Google Calendar, Office 365, ...) Now multiply all these by the number of contats in the roster, and you can see that there is a lot of Presence messages to handle. And this messages are received only when the event pipe is connected. Further more, presence Telephony data To ensure to have accurate information, Telephony settings are obtained using the the event pipe. So we must be first connected to it. Once connected, the SDK waits to receive for the telephony system its status before to ask more information. SDK Events The SDK provides a way to know: when the user is well or badly authenticated: AuthenticationFailed or AuthenticationSucceeded events in Application service are raised when the user is connected/authenticated on both channels AND when enough data are retrieved/refreshed, ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service is raised with a state equals to ConnectionState.Connected Each time a Bubble has been joined, BubbleAffiliationChanged event in Bubbles service is raised. when all Bubbles have been joined (and even if current user has no bubble), BubbleAffiliationsPerformed event in Bubbles service is raised. Note: You can start to use the SDK after the step 2 (before it's now allowed). It you need to use a Bubble, ensure to have received event BubbleAffiliationChanged for this Bubble or wait for event BubbleAffiliationsPerformed The delay between step 2 and step 4 is direclty dependent of the number of active bubbles. After step 2, other data are retrieved, see the list in a next chapter for full details. If at least one channel is disconnected, ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service is raised with a state equals to ConnectionState.Disconnected. To resume: If you don't have to manage a lot of Bubbles, using event ConnectionStateChanged is enough. If you have to manage a lot of of Bubbles, uses event BubbleAffiliationsPerformed to ensure that the SDK has already joined all of them. If you have to manage a lot of of Bubbles but the connection/reconnection delay is very critical for you, uses event BubbleAffiliationChanged to check which Bubbles have been already joined before to use them. You can also use the method IsBubbleAffiliated About Presence, you have in Contacts service 2 events to use if you want to manage them: ContactPresenceChan

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: SDK Rainbow pour l'environnement CSharpConnectez votre application de bureau à RainbowTout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp.Prêt à commencer avec le SDK Rainbow p
content: SDK Rainbow pour l'environnement CSharpConnectez votre application de bureau à RainbowTout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp.Prêt à commencer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp ?Tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp.Premiers pas avec le SDK CSharpTélécharger le SDK CSharpConsulter les exemples CSharpInformations pratiquesVersion: LTS 3.XPubliée: 17 mars 2025Dernière mise à jour: 16 janv. 2026Consulter le journal des modificationsBasculer vers la documentation STSSDK packagé pour l'environnement CSharpLe SDK Rainbow pour CSharp est fourni sous forme de paquet Nuget qui peut être déployé facilement et utilisé dans l'environnement CSharp. C'est une Assembly disponible en .Net Standard 2.0 / 2.1 et .Net 8.0..NET Core 2.0+.NET Framework 4.6.1+Unity 2018.1+Mono 5.4+Xamarin.iOS 10.14+Xamarin.Android 8.0+Universal Windows Platform 10.0.16299+Une fois cela fait, votre application sera connectée à Rainbow et capable d'utiliser tous les services Rainbow disponibles.Un SDK CSharp entièrement documentéLe SDK Rainbow pour CSharp vous fournit les meilleurs services pour vous connecter à Rainbow et s'intégrer à votre application. Ces services ont été soigneusement développés et sont bien documentés avec les détails nécessaires pour vous aider à créer votre application. Des exemples sont également disponibles.Le SDK pour CSharp en un coup d'œil.Découvrez les principaux services fournis par ce SDKUne Assembly en .NETFournit une bibliothèque très efficace pour les environnements .Net Standard 2.0 / 2.1 et .Net 8.0Service de contacts, de recherche et de présenceGérez votre liste de contacts et sachez quand ils sont disponibles, occupés au téléphone ou absents et donc quand vous pouvez les joindre. Recherchez des utilisateurs par nom ou identifiant pour étendre votre réseau.Service de messagerie instantanée en tête-à-têteSoyez notifié des messages entrants des utilisateurs, acquittez-les et envoyez des réponses à vos destinataires. Vous pouvez récupérer l'intégralité de la conversation ou uniquement les messages les plus récents.Service de conversation de groupe (bulles)Créez et invitez des utilisateurs, ou reutilisez vos Bulles afin de discuter ensemble. Dans une Bulle, tout le monde peut participer à la conversation.Service WebRTC audio et vidéoVous pouvez lancer des appels audio et vidéo vers vos contacts en utilisant votre navigateur sans plug-in. Ajoutez la vidéo à un appel audio. Choisissez l'appareil que vous souhaitez utiliser et contrôlez l'appel (activez/désactivez le son).Service de conférence WebRTCVous pouvez vous connecter aux conférences téléphoniques dans une bulle. Contrôlez la vidéo que vous souhaitez voir et contrôlez votre appareil (activez/désactivez le son).Service de journal d'appelsRécupérez l'historique de tous les appels passés depuis votre téléphone PBX ou depuis votre application Rainbow. Vous pouvez être notifié en temps réel d'une nouvelle entrée dans le journal d'appels.Service de téléphonie PSTNVous pouvez lancer un appel ou répondre à n'importe quel appel avec votre téléphone PBX. Le service couvre toutes les fonctionnalités de base de la téléphonie, telles que la mise en attente et la récupération d'un appel, le renvoi d'un appel vers la messagerie vocale, la tenue d'une conférence téléphonique avec plusieurs participants, etc.Service de groupesRegroupez vos contacts par activité, autres,... . Faites de certains groupes vos groupes favoris.Service de partage de fichiersPartagez des fichiers avec un utilisateur dans le cadre d'une conversation Rainbow en "tête-à-tête" ou au sein d'une bulle Rainbow avec plusieurs participants. Téléchargez des fichiers partagés par d'autres dans l'espace de stockage cloud de Rainbow.Service de chaînes d'informationEnvoyez des messages aux chaînes d'information qui peuvent être souscrites par des milliers d'utilisateurs. Abonnez-vous aux chaînes d'information publiques d'autres utilisateurs pour les suivre et recevoir ce qu'ils publient!Toujours connectéUne fois démarré, le SDK est toujours connecté à Rainbow et peut donc gérer les requêtes à l'infini.Support de proxy HTTPLe SDK peut être utilisé au travers d'un proxy HTTP ou HTTPS avec ou sans authentification.Facilité de maintenanceCapacités de journalisation complètes et flexibles pour facilité le débogage.Liens intéressantsApprendre à utiliser nos SDKsBesoin d'aide?Contactez notre équipe supportVisitez notre page d'accueilFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK Medias. This SDK can be used as a standalone package without
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK Medias. This SDK can be used as a standalone package without the need of Rainbow Account, Rainbow Server or Rainbow Infrastructure. This SDK can be used on these platforms: Windows, MacOs, and Linux. Only x64 platforms are supported. Android and iOS are NOT YET supported. Features It permits to manage Audio and Video streams using: Local / Remote Files IP TV, Live Stream Server Devices like Webcam, Screen/Monitor, Microphone, Speaker, Headset, ... To access remote streams all this protocols are supported. An Audio and/or Video Stream (whatever its source) is calles a Media in this SDK. A Media can be composed of one Audio stream and/or one Video stream. Using a Media it's then possible, for example, to create a Media Player: Start, Stop, Pause, Resume, Seek actions are possible. Using one Media or severals, it's then possible to create a MediaFiltered using a Video filter and/or an Audio filter. Video Filter allows to: scale, crop, pad, resize, change fps, add subtitles create mosaic, overlay, dynamic mask Audio filter is not yet supported. The MediaFiltered will use the Audio stream of the specified Media. On the fly you can change the filter. The Audio/Video stream of the MediaFiltered will be updated in consequence without the need to re-start all Media used. Filter - List, Syntax and Examples Filter - List The list of available Audio filters are available here The list of available Video filters are available here Filter - Syntax Same syntax used in FFmpeg can be used in this package. The best thing to do it's to test first your filter using ffmpeg with a command line using "-vf" parameter (to set video filter). The same value can be used as filter in this SDK. Filter - Examples Here some examples than can be used. Using only one Media To have video in gray: format=gray To blur the video: avgblur=10 To scale the video: scale=400:-2 To crop the video: crop=400:400 To draw a text on the video: drawtext=text=%{localtime\: %X }:fontcolor=white:fontsize=40:y=(main_h-text_h)/2:x=(main_w-text_w)/2 To add subtitles on the video using subtitles from the file "c:\media\TOEFLTest.mp4" subtitles=f=c\\:\\\\medias\\\\TOEFLTest.mp4:si=0 Several options can set in same time, for example, to scale then pad the video: scale=200:-2,pad=320:200:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2 Here, we blur a zone of a video and add also subtitles: [0:v]crop=400:400,avgblur=10[fg];[0:v][fg]overlay=(main_w-overlay_w)/2:(main_h-overlay_h)/2[blured];[blured]subtitles=f=c\\:\\\\media\\\\TOEFLTest.mp4:si=0 Using two Medias To display two videos streams in one stream. Each video stream is first scaled and padde to a 320x240 stream. Then they are displayed vertically. [0]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-2,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a0]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-2,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a1]; [a0][a1]xstack=inputs=2:layout=0_0|0_h0[out] The first video stream is scaled then overlay on the second one: [0]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=250:-2[a2]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[a1]; [a1][a2]overlay=x=W-w:y=0 The first video stream is scaled then using a circle and a mask we ouse it as overlay on the second one: [0]scale=250:-1,geq='st(3,pow(X-(W/2),2)+pow(Y-(H/2),2))\;if(lte(ld(3),pow(min(W/2,H/2),2)),255,0):128:128'[scaledMask]; [0]scale=250:-1[scaled]; [scaled][scaledMask]alphamerge[cutout]; [cutout]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[a2]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[a1]; [a1][a2]overlay=x=W-w:y=0 Using more than two Medias Four Video streams are scaled then padded to have a 320x240 output. Then they are used to create a grid of 2x2: [0]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a0]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a1]; [2]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a2]; [3]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a3]; [a0][a1][a2][a3]xstack=inputs=4:grid=2x2 Six Video streams are scaled then padded to have a 320x240 output. Then theyr used to create a grid of 2x3: [0]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a0]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a1]; [2]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a2]; [3]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a3]; [4]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a4]; [5]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a5]; [a0][a1][a2][a3][a4][a5]xstack=inputs=6:grid=2x3 Nine Video streams are scaled then padded to have a 320x240 output. Then theyr used to create a grid of 3x3: [0]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2,format=rgb24[a0]; [1]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=320:-1,pad=320:240:(

content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01ComparerSDK.Medias for C# [1.8.0] - 2026-01-16 Changed Update code to remove compilation warnings [1.7.0] - 2025-11-20 Fixed MediaEncoder object CreateMediaVideoEncoder() method: No more use GlobalQuality but GopSize to manage key frame MediaInput, MediaRtpInput, MediaFiltered objects exception could occurred when end of input file is reached Added Added .Net 10.0 as target framework Changed MediaInput, MediaRtpInput, MediaFiltered objects standardizes RaiseOnVideoSample() methods [1.6.0] - 2025-09-01 Fixed MediaFilterd, MediaInput, MediaRtpInput objects: Add more check when frame is converted / encoded Use global lock to avoid crash when objects are released MediaRtpInput object: ensure to read all frames from packet [1.5.0] - 2025-07-07 Added MediaRtpInput object: Add new optional parameters in constructor to allow to set ffmpeg options Default options are now: "reorder_queue_size" set to 32 (from 2048) add "fflags" and set it to "+discardcorrupt+genpts+nofillin+nobuffer" Changed Update Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions dependency package to v9.0.0 (from v8.0.0) [1.4.0] - 2025-04-23 Fixed Noisy sound when using Microphone as audio input stream Changed MediaInput service: in FromScreenDevice() and FromWebcamDevice() methods add loggerPrefix as optional parameter Update Concentus dependency package to v2.2.2 (from v1.1.6) [1.3.0] - 2025-03-12 Fixed Devices service: when plugged/unplugged, store new devices list (screens, webcams, audio inputs and/or audio outputs) before to trigger device added / removed events. So it's possible to know this list when the event is received MediaInput service: change how 'live stream' are managed MediaRtpInput service: fix noisy incoming sound Added MediaInput service: FromScreenDevice(), FromWebcamDevice() methods Helper: InitExternalLibraries() method now allows to initialize video features of SDL2 library SDL2Helper: GetPixelFormat() to get SDL2 pixel format from ffmpeg pixel format SDL2AudioOutput: ClearQueue() SDL2 namespace: it's know totally public. Allow to access to all SDL2 features [1.2.0] - 2024-11-22 Added Devices service: OnWebcamDeviceAdded, OnWebcamDeviceRemoved, OnScreenDeviceAdded, OnScreenDeviceRemoved, OnAudioInputDeviceRemoved, OnAudioInputDeviceAdded, OnAudioOutputDeviceRemoved, OnAudioOutputDeviceAdded events IMedia interface: Device property Changed Breaking IMedia interface: rename Stop() to StopAsync(), Pause() to PauseAsync(), SetVideoBitRate() to SetMaxVideoBitRate() Breaking IMedia interface: remove Context() property Breaking SDL2AudioInput object: needs now a Device in the constructor Breaking SDL2AudioOutput object: needs now a Device in the constructor [1.1.0] - 2024-10-01 Fixed Improve the way to get/calculate Fps. (avoid NaN results) Changed IMediaVideoBase interface: add VideoStreamPixelFormat, VideoStreamTimeBase and VideoStreamSampleAspectRatio properties. MediaFiltered, MediaInput and MediaRtpInput are updated in consequence. MediaFiltered object: add a constructor allowing to use IMediaVideo and/or IMediaAudio MediaFiltered object: add AddMediaVideoInput() and AddMediaAudioInput() [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Fixed Improve the way to get/calculate Fps. Avoid to use several streams when grabbing remote videos (for CCTV for example) Changed Use FFmpeg.AutoGen package v7.0.0 (from v6.0.0.2) Use FFmpeg v7.0.1 shared libraries (from v6.0) .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.0 are still in targets platform. [0.0.9-STS] - 2024-03-19 Fixed Allow to stream as video a JPG file (already possible with BMP, TIFF, PNG, WEBP (with one image), ...). GIF are also supported but not WEBP with animation due to FFmpeg limitation Changed Use Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions v8.0.0.0 (from v7.0.0.0) [0.0.8-STS] - 2024-01-15 Added Add .Net 8.0 as target plateform (.Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still in targets platform) .Net 6.0 target platform will be removed in April. [0.0.7-STS] - 2023-10-18 Added MediaInput: allow to set widht, height, fps and bit rate used in encoding process. Take into account options set in the device InputStreamDevice: Allow to set options [0.0.6-STS] - 2023-09-05 Added Add SetVideoBitRate() in MediaInput, MediaRtpInput and MediaFiltered Changed Use FFmpeg.AutoGen v6.0.0.2. Use FFmpeg v6.0 libraries. Enhancement in parser used to set filters [0.0.5] - STS - 2023-07-07 .Net Core App 3.1 is no more targetted (already deprecated by Microsoft). .Net Standardd 2.0 / 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still targetted [0.0.4] - STS - 2023-05-26 Fix MediaRTPInput: Some internal values was not resetted correctly MediaFiltered: When a new filter is set, it's necessary to dispose ALL previous objects to ensure to build correct frames [0.0.3] - STS - 2023-02-10 Enhancements It's now possible to decode RTP packets (Audio and/or Video) using MediaRtpInput object. A valid SDP must be provided which describes codecs to use to decode them. It p

content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Abstractions This SDK provides provides common interfaces and objects to implement/use to be compatible with WebRTC features provided by the Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC library. It cannot be used directly except if you want to create a new implementation to support WebRTC features in another environment. Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1 and .Net 8.0 Implementations available: For the moment, there 2 differents implementations available: Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Desktop library compatible with Windows, MacOs, and Linux Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Unity library (for the moment used in private usage only) Sur cette pageNuget packageImplementations available:Ce contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop This SDK provides additional services / tools for these platforms: Windows, MacOs, and Linux. Only x64 platform is supported. It uses as dependencies Rainbow.CSharp.SDK, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias and Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions libraries. Te be more precise this library is a specific implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions which target Desktop platforms (as opposed to mobile platforms like Android or iOS). Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1 and .Net 8.0 WebRTC features Since this library is a implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions, it provides same features than the ones described in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC library. So please refer to the documentation of this library Third-Party Libraries This implementation is using Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias library. So please refer also to the documentation of this library to know how to use it to manage medias and alos to know which third party libraires must be installed. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features to
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.XPubliée le 2025-03-17Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features to the Rainbow CSharp SDK (core) library. So you need first to understand how to use it. Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1 and .Net 8.0 WebRTC features Permits to manage WebRTC communications: Peer To Peer or in a Conference using Rainbow environment (https://developers.openrainbow.com/home) Peer To Peer communication features: Answer, Decline, Make, Retract, Hang up call Add / Remove Video or Sharing Mute / Unmute Audio, Video or Sharing Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Output is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Conference features: Start, Join Conference Participants list Publishers list Mute / Unmute: current user but also other Peers if current user is a moderator of the conference Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Display Active Talker. Current user of this SDK is never seen as Active Talker (work still in progress) Add / Remove Video or Sharing Subscribe (automatically or manualy) to publication of Peers (Video or Sharing) Request / Refuse / Accept Sharing transfert Conference delegation Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Ouput is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Abstractions and Implementations This package use abstractions to offer those WebRTC features based on specific implementations. For the moment, two implementations are available: Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop Third library used: SIPSorcery, FFmpeg libraries and SDL2 Comptatible Windows, MacOs and Linux platforms Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Unity Available only in private access for the moment Third library used: Unity and WebRTC for Unity Comptatible with Windows, MacOs and Linux, Android, iOS platforms Developping with the Rainbow.WebRTC SDK Quick overview on how to use the Rainbow.WebRTC sdk to develop a webrtc enabled application. It is intended to be about general principles and is not specific to the implementation. For specific, check documentation of he implementation you want to use. Instantiation Create a Rainbow.Application object Rainbow Application myApp = new Rainbow.Application(); Configure application credentials and platform Enable restrictions on Conferences Monitor ConnectionStateChanged and InitializationPerformed Call Login() The SDK will try to connect to the platform using the supplied (application and user) credentials. If it failed you are informed in the optional callback. When it's done initializing and retrieving informations it will raise the InitializationPerformed signal. At this stage the SDK can be used. If your application makes use of bubbles or conferences, when InitializationPerformed is received it should call Bubbles.GetAllBubbles(). It is the right time to instantiate a WebRTCCommunications object, which will make it possible make calls or join conference. You can find more informations about the Rainbow SDK Here. This quick diagram summarizes how to initialize an application who would use WebRTCCommunications. Events in WebRTCCommunications The most importants events to handle to issue webrtc calls in your applications are CallUpdated , MediaPublicationUpdated and OnTrack. When a user receives a call, or is issuing the call, the WebRTCCommunications class informs him of the progression of the call using the CallUpdated events. The event provides you with an instance of the Call class, containing many useful information like The status The local and remote medias established on the call The participants The call Id which is needed to perform actions on this calls, like decline the call, hangup, publish some medias.. The other important event to handle is MediaPublicationUpdated. This happens each time a local or remote media is added to the call. A MediaPublicationUpdated event provides a MediaPublication object which can be used to subscribe to a MediaPublication using the method WebRTCCommunications.SubscribeToMediaPublication. Calling this method means that your application is interested in this media. If you subscribe to a media publication WebRTCommunications will send you the associated MediaStreamTrack using OnTrack event. Making Calls and Receiving Calls Here is a simplified (and incomplete) diagram showing how to use WebRTCCommunications events and methods to establish an audio Peer to peer call, using the MakeCall method. When another user calls your application, WebRTCCommunications emits a CallUpdated with a CallStatus of RINGING_INCOMING . To accept the call use WebRTCCommunications.AnswerCall, and to decline use WebRTCCommunications.RejectCall. What happens after AnswerCall is similar to what happens after

content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 2.XPubliée le 2025-03-17ComparerSDK.WebRTC for C# [2.5.0] - 2026-01-16 Changed Update code to remove compilation warnings [2.4.0] - 2025-11-20 Fixed Improve test to avoid crash if an incorrect ICE candidate is used. If there is no more Video MediaPublication in a conference, ensure to unsubscribe to DynamicFeed if necessary. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedGetting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK Common ! This SDK provides additional services / tools for all platforms (Windows, MacOs, iOs, A
content: DocumentationGetting startedGetting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK Common ! This SDK provides additional services / tools for all platforms (Windows, MacOs, iOs, Android, Linux, ...) It uses as core the Rainbow CSharp SDK (core)* library. So you need first to understand how to use it. Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here Dependencies are all managed by Nuget package system. This package targets .Net Standard 2.0 and .Net Core App 3.1 Avatars service This service permits to download Contacts or Bubbles avatar (multiplatform): Avatars If a Bubble has none avatar set, this service create one using Contact avatars based on the bubble members (using 1 to 4 members) If a Contact has none avatar set, this service create one using Contact Initials with background color based on the contact display name. If an avatar is updated on server side, this service download it automatically and raise event to inform in consequence if a Contact or Bubble avatar has been updated. Local folders are used to store avatars. Several types of Avatars are stored (See AvatarType) and it's possible for each to set their sizes. It's possible to allow / disallow avatar download according the situation. ImageTools library Library to manipulate Image (multiplatform): ImageTools Get bitmap from file / Save bitmap to file Get Stream from bitmap Create bitmap Draw bitmap on another Resize bitmap Get SVG from resources in the package Create Bitmap from SVG (colors from original SVG can be changed to others one) Languages service This service permits to get labels in the specified language (multiplatform): Languages By default 'en' is used as language Id. To get the list of languages Id available use GetLanguagesList() method To change the language use SetLanguage() method The event LanguageChanged() permits to know if the language has been changed Sur cette pageGetting StartedNuget packageAvatars serviceImageTools libraryLanguages serviceCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationChangelogSDK.Common for C# [2.6.18-LTS] - 2024-07-01 Changed Colors list used to create Avatars has been changed. .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2
content: DocumentationChangelogSDK.Common for C# [2.6.18-LTS] - 2024-07-01 Changed Colors list used to create Avatars has been changed. .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.0 are still in targets platform. [2.6.17-LTS] - 2024-05-27 Added ImageTools: GetSvgAsStringFromResourceName() New SVG files added (528 in total) [2.6.16-LTS] - 2024-03-19 Fixed The avatar of a bubble based on the avatars of its members will no longer contain the initials of one or more of these members Changed Breaking GetBitmapFromSvgResourceName() and GetBitmapFromSvgFile(): No longer return a square image but respect the SVG layout. A width parameter replaces the old size parameter. The height is automatically calculated. Avatars: now use logger prefix set in Rainbow.Application to create folder where Avatars are stored - so by default it will be Path.Combine(application.GetIniPathFolder(), "Resources", $"{prefix}Avatars") Files: now use logger prefix set in Rainbow.Application to create folder where Files are stored - so by default it will be Path.Combine(application.GetIniPathFolder(), "Resources", $"{prefix}Files") Update all labels for 22 languages Upgrade package SkiaSharp to 2.88.7 from 2.88.6 (since a rollback of dependencies used in this package has been done in this new version) Use Svg.Skia 1.0.0.13 instead of SkiaSharp.Svg 1.60.0 to allow to manage more type of SVG Added Include more than 500 SVG (before ~60 SVG) [2.6.15-LTS] - 2024-01-15 Added Add .Net 8.0 as target plateform (.Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still in targets platform) .Net 6.0 target platform will be removed in April. Changed Upgrade dependency package SkiaSharp to 2.88.6 from 2.80.3 (due to high security vulnerability) [2.6.14-LTS] - 2023-09-05 Changed Technical delivery to use SDK C# (Core) v2.6.18 [2.6.13] - LTS - 2023-07-07 .Net Core App 3.1 is no more targetted (already deprecated by Microsoft). .Net Standardd 2.0 / 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still targetted [2.6.12] - LTS - 2023-05-26 Dependency no more used: Newtonsoft.Json Update all labels to the most recent version [2.6.11] - LTS - 2023-05-03 Technical delivery due to SDK (core) updates [2.6.10] - LTS - 2022-07-12 Technical delivery to modify the validity date of the SDK [2.6.9] - LTS - 2022-05-10 Enriched documentation Technical delivery to modify the validity date of the SDK [2.6.8] - LTS - 2022-08-23 Enhancements It's now possible to log on different files if several instance of the SDK (Core) is used in sametime (for example if you use several bots in the same process). You need to set to the new parameter loggerPrefix a different value for each instance when Rainbow.Application object is created. You also need to use a different configuration file for your logger. See the online documentation for more details. In consequence the way to create these services have changed: Avatars, Languages and ImageTools: // Create Rainbow.Application - here with a logger prefix String prefix = "BOT01_"; // This can be null or empty if you don't need it var application = new Rainbow.Application(loggerPrefix: prefix); // ------------------------------------------------- // Before Avatars service was created like this: var avatars = Rainbow.Common.Avatars.Instance; avatars.SetApplication(application); // Now we use this to create Avatars service: var avatars = Rainbow.Common.Avatars.CreateInstance(application); // ------------------------------------------------- // Before Languages service was created like this: var languages = Rainbow.Common.Languages.Instance; // Now we use this to create Languages service: var languages = Rainbow.Common.Languages.CreateInstance(application); // ------------------------------------------------- // Before ImageTools service was composed of only static methods. Now you need to create it before to use any methods var imageTools = Rainbow.Common.ImageTools.CreateInstance(application); [2.6.7] - LTS - 2022-06-15 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.6] - LTS - 2022-05-23 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.5] - LTS - 2022-05-04 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.4] - LTS - 2022-04-07 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.3] - LTS - 2022-03-16 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.2] - LTS - 2022-01-27 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.1] - LTS - 2021-12-08 No update since last LTS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages SDK (core) [2.6.0] - LTS - 2021-11-18 No update since last STS version - Increase release versions to be consistent with other packages

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK (core) ! It's an Assembly library based on CSharp for conn
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK (core) ! It's an Assembly library based on CSharp for connecting your application to Rainbow. This assembly is multi-platform: you can use it on Windows, MacOs, Linux but also on Android, iOS and more. Its powerful APIs enable you to create the best application that connect to Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow. This tutorial will help you start with the ALE Rainbow SDK for CSharp (Core) by setting your environment wether you are using Windows, Linux or MacOS. UI Controls according to build quickly / easily an applicatin are provided in others packages specific by platform. But their interface are the same what ever the platform. Prerequisites Assembly in .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net 6.0 and .Net 8.0 The SDK is an Assembly targeting .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net 6.0 and .Net 6.0 so it can be used in those environments: .NET and .Net Core 2.0+ .NET Framework 4.6.1+ Mono 5.4+ Xamarin.iOS 10.14+ Xamarin.Android 8.0+ Unity 2018.1+ Universal Windows Platform 10.0.16299+ More details here Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here Dependencies are all managed by Nuget package system. Development environment You can use: "Visual Studio for Windows" - the community edition is free "Visual Studio for Mac" "Visual Studio Code" - Free for Linux, Mac and Windows If you are using a computer running on MacOS, you can follow this guide to setup your development environment. Setup your Visual Studio project Install "Rainbow.CSharp.SDK" as Nuget package In Studio Visual Studio 2019 (or more recent) Use the NuGet Package Manager UI and install the package "Rainbow.CSharp.SDK" Initialize the SDK Step 1 : Create a Rainbow application on the developers web site To use the SDK you need an applicationID and a secretKey from the developers website. These information allow you to identify your application and allow you to use the rainbow platform. For more information, see Applications lifecycle which explains what is the purpose, how to create an application and how to get the application ID and the secret key. The hostname is also necessary to know which server is used: the sandbox or the production server Step 2 : Initialize the SDK In your development environment, create an Rainbow.Application object like this: Rainbow.Application myApp = new Rainbow.Application(); myApp.SetApplicationInfo(applicationID, secretKey); myApp.SetHostInfo(hostname); Where myApp is your application object: with applicationID / secretKey from your Rainbow application created in step 1. with hostname according the server used (`sandbox.openrainbow.com' or 'openrainbow.com') After that you can Connect to Rainbow.
