excerpt: DocumentationJSON parserLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13JSON To avoid dependency to complex library like NewtonSoft.Json or System.Text.Json to build JSON string from a node-tree or to generate
content: DocumentationJSON parserLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13JSON To avoid dependency to complex library like NewtonSoft.Json or System.Text.Json to build JSON string from a node-tree or to generate a node tree from any valid JSON string the SDK includes SimpleJSON library. It's a small library but do the job quite well and ensure to the SDK to be AOT (Ahead Of Time) compatible - mandatory for the SDK to support some specific environmen like Unity with IL2CPP backend This choice also avoid to follow evolution/corrections of NewtonSoft.Json or System.Text.Json. This document explains how to use this embedded library with some utility methods added to facilitate the job. SimpleJSON objects JSONNode is a abstract class which is the base of all others objects JSONString inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is a string in JSON representation (so potentially referencing a C# standard type like String, DateTime, ) JSONNumber inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is a number in JSON representation (so potentially referencing a C# standard type like int, double, float, decimal, etc ...) JSONBool inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is a boolean in JSON representation JSONNull inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is a null value in JSON representation JSONObject inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is an object in JSON representation. So it contains one or several childrens JSONArray inherits from JSONNode calls and represent a JSON Node which is an array in JSON representation. So it contains one or several childrens Value property of a JSONNode gives the JSON representation of the node. Tag property of a JSONNode gives the JSONNodeType of the node: Array, Object, String, Number, NullValue, Boolean, None. You have also properties IsArray, IsObject, IsString, IsNumber, IsNull, IsBool You have the possibility to add/remove nodes by value, key or index. You have also enumerators and Count property You have also the possibility to access sub-node by index or by key JSONNode jsonNode; // A valid JSONNode object ... // Access a sub-node by key var subNodeByKey = jsonNode["id"]; // Access a sub-node by index var subNodeByIndex = jsonNode[0]; UtilJSON class The UtilJSON class has been created to simplify the way to create an object from a JSON String and to create JSON String from an object. AsInt, AsDouble, AsString, ... permits to get an int, double, string .. for an existing JSONNode using the specified key. A default value can be set if the key as not be found. JSONNode jsonNode; // A valid JSONNode object ... // Get a String of the sub node using "id" as key. An empty String is returne is not found. Id = UtilJson.AsString(jsonNode, "id"); // Get a String of the sub node using "availabitily" as key. "offline" is returned if not found. Availabitily = UtilJson.AsString(jsonNode, "availabitily", "offline"); // Get a Boolean of the sub node using "isTerminated" as key. True is returned if not found. IsTerminated = UtilJson.AsBoolean(jsonNode, "isTerminated", true); Several AddNode methods permit to add to a JSONNode a new sub-node as int, double, string, ... JSONNode jsonNode; // A valid JSONNode object ... // Add a sub-node to jsonNode as String using the key "id" and the value "id_1234" UtilJson.AddNode(jsonNode, "id", "id_1234"); // Add a sub-node to jsonNode as DateTime using the key "lastUpdate" and the dateTime object DateTime dateTime = DateTime.UtcNow; UtilJson.AddNode(jsonNode, "lastUpdate", dateTime); Full example Contact object is used here as example to demonstrate how to create a JSON String from a Contact object and to create a Contact object from a JSON String. Contact object contains a lot of properties with a standard type (i.e. String, DateTime, etc ...) and three properties not standard: Calendars, Emails, PhoneNumbers So we need first to parse from/to JSON this objects: Calendar, EmailObject and PhoneNumber For each of them, we add this methods: TryJsonParse: To create an object from a JSON String TryToJson: From an object create a JSON String public class Calendar { ... /// <summary> /// Converts the specified JSON String to its <see cref="Calendar"/> equivalent and returns a value that indicates whetever the conversion succeeded /// </summary> /// <param name="jsonString"><see cref="String"/>JSON String</param> /// <param name="calendar"><see cref="Calendar"/>Calendar object</param> /// <returns><see cref="Boolean"/> - True on success</returns> public static Boolean TryJsonParse(string jsonString, out Calendar calendar) { return TryJsonParse(JSON.Parse(jsonString), out calendar); } /// <summary> /// Converts the specified <see cref="JSONNode"/> to its <see cref="Calendar"/> equivalent and returns a value that indicates whetever the conversion succeeded /// </summary> /// <param name="jsonNode"><see cref="JSONNode"/>JSONNode object</param> /// <param name="calendar"><see cref="Calendar

content: DocumentationDevelopment KitLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Development Kit The Rainbow CSharp SDK Development Kit contains: An CSharp Assembly library: This assembly has to be included using Nuget platform. Several starter kit applications to demonstrate how to use it. Small samples (as Desktop applications) to understand how to use the SDK (available on on Windows, MacOS) Advanced sample (as Mobile application) going deeper in SDK available for IOS and MacOs S2S (Server to Server) (as 'BOT application') to understand how to use S2S event mode CSharp assembly library The Rainbow CSharp SDK is available via Nuget. See the Getting started guide to understand how to load it. Starter kits - Small samples To understand how the the SDK for CSharp must be used, some projects or starter kit are available on Github. (for Windows and MacOS) You can have access to these samples by cloning the GitHub project: Rainbow-CSharp-SDK-Samples Examples are listed in order of priority if you just start to use the SDK. ProjectDescriptionWindowsMacOs ContactsManage list of contactsLinkLink Conversations / FavoritesManage list of conversations and favoritesLinkLink Instant MessagingSend, receive simple IM messages, manage presenceLinkLink ConferencesManage Conferences (PSTN or WebRTC): Start/Join/Stop, Mute/Unmute, Lock/Unlock, Drop participant)LinkLink TelephonyPSTN: Make / Release call, Hold / Unhold, Transfer / Conference, Call forward, Nomadic status, Voice MailLink Starter kits - Advanced Mobile Application Sample It's an advanced example of Instant Messaging for IOS and MacOs: Advanced sample Some screenshoots of this sample: Login Conversations List Conversation Stream Starter kits - S2S as BOT sample application It's important to read this guide first to understand what is a S2S application and the architecture associated. This sample permits to understand how to use this SDK in Server to server contetx. It's better first to understand how to use the SDK using small examples. This sample is based on the small sample Instant Messaging but using S2S event mode. content: DocumentationSDK and server errorsLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Errors list Most of SDK methods use SdkResult<T> object to provide a result or the reason of the error If no error occurs SdkResult<T>.Result.Succcess is equals to True. In this case SdkResult<T>.Data contains an object on T type. If an error occurs SdkResult<T>.Result.Succcess is equals to False. To get information about the error the SdkResult<T>.Result (which is a SdkError object) cand be used. There is three type of SdkError - see SdkErrorType: SdkErrorType.NoError: There is no error. You have to use SdkResult<T>.Data SdkErrorType.Exception: An unexpected exception has occurred. To have more information readable information use SdkError.ToString() or use SdkError.Exception object SdkErrorType.IncorrectUse: The way to use the method is not done correctly (network error, server errors, or sdk errors - like invalid parameter). In this case properties you can use ErrorCode, ErrorDetailsCode, ErrorDetails and ErrorDetailsData of the object SdkError.IncorrectUseError for more information. if SdkErrorType.IncorrectUse.ErrorCode is equals to 1000, it means that the SDK itself has raised an error. For other values, it means that the Rainbowserver has raised an error. Find below a full list of potential errors returned by the SDK or by the server. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationData in cacheLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Data storage and connection / reconnection Prerequisite You must first know how to connect and manage auto-reconnection service using th
content: DocumentationData in cacheLTS release 2.6.XPubliée le 2021-12-13Data storage and connection / reconnection Prerequisite You must first know how to connect and manage auto-reconnection service using the SDK: Connect to Rainbow. Auto Reconnection. Introduction The SDK cannot retrieve all data "at once" once connected to the server. In addition, this connection can be interrupted and the data must be synchronized again. This guide aims: To list what data is stored To understand when they are available they depend on the user's license they depend on the options used in the SDK To understand the connection and reconnection problem to synchronize this data The last chapter, via code examples, shows how to handle all of this. Connection / Reconnection (REST and Event Pipe) The SDK is connected to the Rainbow server using two different channels: REST API (HTTP requests): asynchonous connection based on secutiry token with a "time to live" XMPP (or eventually S2S) event pipe: web socket connection which needs permanent connection. From a global point of view, REST API is used for static data and event pipe for dynamic data (presence, instant messaging, ...) To be fully operational, the SDK must create a valid link on both channels (authenticated, connected) and have enough data/information (license, settings, ...) after connection or a reconnection. As developper, you only know if the SDK is connected or not using event ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service but you cannot know which one specificalyy is connected/disconnected. To give more details, event pipe disconnection occurs more often. For example, if there is a network trouble for a short period, the event pipe will be disconnected but not the REST API channel. And usually, if the REST API channel is disconnected, the event pipe is also disconnected. Bubbles and how they are managed To receive or send messages or to get dynamic information about a Bubble (for example that there is a conference in progress), the SDK must first join it. It also called a bubble affiliation. The SDK can do it: only when the event pipe connection is operational and join Bubbles one by one. So, the more bubbles you have, the longer it takes to join them all. Contacts presence To know the Aggregated Presence (also called Unified Ptesence) of one contact, the SDK must first receive information of each of his devices: One for each client used: Rainbow Web client, Rainbow Mobile Phone (Adnroid and/or iOS, ...) Optionnaly, one to manage his telephony device (Rainbow Hub or OXO/OXE) Optionnaly, one to manage his calendar presence (Google Calendar, Office 365, ...) Optionnaly, one to manage his Team presence (Google Calendar, Office 365, ...) Now multiply all these by the number of contats in the roster, and you can see that there is a lot of Presence messages to handle. And this messages are received only when the event pipe is connected. Further more, presence Telephony data To ensure to have accurate information, Telephony settings are obtained using the the event pipe. So we must be first connected to it. Once connected, the SDK waits to receive for the telephony system its status before to ask more information. SDK Events The SDK provides a way to know: when the user is connected/authenticated on both channels, ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service is raised with a state equals to ConnectionState.Connected when enough data are retrieved/refreshed, InitializationPerformed event in Application service is raised. Each time a Bubble has been joined, BubbleAffiliationChanged event in Bubbles service is raised. when all Bubbles have been joined (and even if current user has no bubble), BubbleAffiliationsPerformed event in Bubbles service is raised. Note: You can start to use the SDK after the step 2 (before it's now allowed). It you need to use a Bubble, ensure to have received event BubbleAffiliationChanged for this Bubble or wait for event BubbleAffiliationsPerformed The delay between step 2 and step 4 is direclty dependent of the number of active bubbles. After step 2, other data are retrieved, see the list in a next chapter for full details. If at least one channel is disconnected, ConnectionStateChanged event in Application service is raised with a state equals to ConnectionState.Disconnected. To resume: If you don't have to manage a lot of Bubbles, using event InitializationPerformed is enough. If you have to manage a lot of of Bubbles, uses event BubbleAffiliationsPerformed to ensure that the SDK has already joined all of them. If you have to manage a lot of of Bubbles but the connection/reconnection delay is very critical for you, uses event BubbleAffiliationChanged to check which Bubbles have been already joined before to use them. You can also use the method IsBubbleAffiliated About Presence, you have in Contacts service 2 events to use if you want to manage them: ContactPresenceChanged: Event triggered when the presence of one of a user's devices is m

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: SDK Rainbow pour l'environnement CSharpConnectez votre application de bureau à RainbowTout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp.Ce SDK CSharp est obsolèteCette versio
content: SDK Rainbow pour l'environnement CSharpConnectez votre application de bureau à RainbowTout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour CSharp.Ce SDK CSharp est obsolèteCette version du SDK CSharp est désormais obsolète. Elle continuera de fonctionner, mais il n'y aura plus ni d'évolutions ni de corrections. Nous vous invitons à migrer vers la version 3. Veuillez suivre le lien ci-dessous pour lire le guide de migration.Migrer vers le SDK CSharp V3Informations pratiquesVersion: LTS 2.6.XPubliée: 13 déc. 2021Dernière mise à jour: 22 nov. 2024Consulter le journal des modificationsLe SDK pour CSharp en un coup d'œil.Découvrez les principaux services fournis par ce SDKUne Assembly en .NETFournit une bibliothèque très efficace pour les environnements .Net Standard 2.0 / 2.1 et .Net 8.0 ( .NET Core 2.0+, .NET Framework 4.6.1+, Mono 5.4+, Xamarin.iOS 10.14+, Xamarin.Android 8.0+, Unity 2018.1+, Universal Windows Platform 10.0.16299+ )Service de contacts, de recherche et de présenceGérez votre liste de contacts et sachez quand ils sont disponibles, occupés au téléphone ou absents et donc quand vous pouvez les joindre. Recherchez des utilisateurs par nom ou identifiant pour étendre votre réseau.Service de messagerie instantanée en tête-à-têteSoyez notifié des messages entrants des utilisateurs, acquittez-les et envoyez des réponses à vos destinataires. Vous pouvez récupérer l'intégralité de la conversation ou uniquement les messages les plus récents.Service de conversation de groupe (bulles)Créez et invitez des utilisateurs, ou reutilisez vos Bulles afin de discuter ensemble. Dans une Bulle, tout le monde peut participer à la conversation.Service WebRTC audio et vidéoVous pouvez lancer des appels audio et vidéo vers vos contacts en utilisant votre navigateur sans plug-in. Ajoutez la vidéo à un appel audio. Choisissez l'appareil que vous souhaitez utiliser et contrôlez l'appel (activez/désactivez le son).Service de conférence WebRTCVous pouvez vous connecter aux conférences téléphoniques dans une bulle. Contrôlez la vidéo que vous souhaitez voir et contrôlez votre appareil (activez/désactivez le son).Service de journal d'appelsRécupérez l'historique de tous les appels passés depuis votre téléphone PBX ou depuis votre application Rainbow. Vous pouvez être notifié en temps réel d'une nouvelle entrée dans le journal d'appels.Service de téléphonie PSTNVous pouvez lancer un appel ou répondre à n'importe quel appel avec votre téléphone PBX. Le service couvre toutes les fonctionnalités de base de la téléphonie, telles que la mise en attente et la récupération d'un appel, le renvoi d'un appel vers la messagerie vocale, la tenue d'une conférence téléphonique avec plusieurs participants, etc.Service de groupesRegroupez vos contacts par activité, autres,... . Faites de certains groupes vos groupes favoris.Service de partage de fichiersPartagez des fichiers avec un utilisateur dans le cadre d'une conversation Rainbow en "tête-à-tête" ou au sein d'une bulle Rainbow avec plusieurs participants. Téléchargez des fichiers partagés par d'autres dans l'espace de stockage cloud de Rainbow.Service de chaînes d'informationEnvoyez des messages aux chaînes d'information qui peuvent être souscrites par des milliers d'utilisateurs. Abonnez-vous aux chaînes d'information publiques d'autres utilisateurs pour les suivre et recevoir ce qu'ils publient!Toujours connectéUne fois démarré, le SDK est toujours connecté à Rainbow et peut donc gérer les requêtes à l'infini.Support de proxy HTTPLe SDK peut être utilisé au travers d'un proxy HTTP ou HTTPS avec ou sans authentification.Facilité de maintenanceCapacités de journalisation complètes et flexibles pour facilité le débogage.Liens intéressantsApprendre à utiliser nos SDKsBesoin d'aide?Contactez notre équipe supportVisitez notre page d'accueilFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01ComparerSDK.Medias for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Fixed Improves the way to get/calculate Fps. Avoid to use several streams when grabbing remote
content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01ComparerSDK.Medias for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Fixed Improves the way to get/calculate Fps. Avoid to use several streams when grabbing remote videos (for CCTV for example) Changed Use FFmpeg.AutoGen package v7.0.0 (from v6.0.0.2) Use FFmpeg v7.0.1 shared libraries (from v6.0) .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.0 are still in targets platform. [0.0.9-STS] - 2024-03-19 Fixed Allow to stream as video a JPG file (already possible with BMP, TIFF, PNG, WEBP (with one image), ...). GIF are also supported but not WEBP with animation due to FFmpeg limitation Changed Use Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions v8.0.0.0 (from v7.0.0.0) [0.0.8-STS] - 2024-01-15 Added Add .Net 8.0 as target plateform (.Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still in targets platform) .Net 6.0 target platform will be removed in April. [0.0.7-STS] - 2023-10-18 Added MediaInput: allow to set widht, height, fps and bit rate used in encoding process. Take into account options set in the device InputStreamDevice: Allow to set options [0.0.6-STS] - 2023-09-05 Added Add SetVideoBitRate() in MediaInput, MediaRtpInput and MediaFiltered Changed Use FFmpeg.AutoGen v6.0.0.2. Use FFmpeg v6.0 libraries. Enhancement in parser used to set filters [0.0.5] - STS - 2023-07-07 .Net Core App 3.1 is no more targetted (already deprecated by Microsoft). .Net Standardd 2.0 / 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still targetted [0.0.4] - STS - 2023-05-26 Fix MediaRTPInput: Some internal values was not resetted correctly MediaFiltered: When a new filter is set, it's necessary to dispose ALL previous objects to ensure to build correct frames [0.0.3] - STS - 2023-02-10 Enhancements It's now possible to decode RTP packets (Audio and/or Video) using MediaRtpInput object. A valid SDP must be provided which describes codecs to use to decode them. It possible for the moment to manage only one Audio track and/or one Video Track. If you have several tracks for a same media, it's possible to specify which one to use using an index. [0.0.2] - STS - 2023-01-20 Enhancements Major rework to avoid memory leak. Use of IDisposable interface in objects using unmanaged objects to ensure to dispose them. Rework interfaces (IMedia, IMediaVideo, IMediaAudio, IMediaVideoOutput, IMediaAudioOutput) and inheritances in major objects: MediaInput, MediaFiltered and MediaOutput API In details IMedia interface (now inherits from IDisposable) Loop: added To know if we loop automatically if the end of file is reached Duration: added Duration in seconds of the Media (if not a life stream) LiveStream: added To know the Media is a 'live steam' i.e. a remote stream for a live stream server, live camera or an IPTV for example OnEndOfFile: added Event raised when the Media as reached the end of the file. Init: added To init the media. IMediaVideo interface: Loop: removed Duration: removed LiveStream: removed Init: removed IMediaVideoOutput interface: added GotVideoFrame: added To add Video Frame to this Media Video Output MediaFiltered now inherits from IMediaVideo and IMediaAudio SDL2AudioInput implements IMedia interface SDL2AudioOutput implements IMedia interface MediaFormat static class: remoced data/methods are now in Helper class [0.0.1] - STS - 2022-12-07 This is the first version of this SDK. Please refer to the "getting started" guides for feature details Sur cette pageSDK.Medias for C#[1.0.0] - 2024-07-01[0.0.9-STS] - 2024-03-19[0.0.8-STS] - 2024-01-15[0.0.7-STS] - 2023-10-18[0.0.6-STS] - 2023-09-05[0.0.5] - STS - 2023-07-07[0.0.4] - STS - 2023-05-26Fix[0.0.3] - STS - 2023-02-10Enhancements[0.0.2] - STS - 2023-01-20EnhancementsAPI In details[0.0.1] - STS - 2022-12-07Ce contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 0.0.6Publiée le 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop This SDK provides additional services / tools for these platforms: Windows, MacOs, and Linux. Only x64 platform is supported. It uses as dependencies Rainbow.CSharp.SDK, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias and Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions libraries. Te be more precise this library is a specific implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions which target Desktop platforms (as opposed to mobile platforms like Android or iOS). Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net Core App 3.1 and .Net 6.0 WebRTC features Since this library is a implementation of Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions, it provides same features than the ones described in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC library. So please refer to the documentation of this library Third-Party Libraries This implementation is using Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.Medias library. So please refer also to the documentation of this library to know how to use it to manage medias and alos to know which third party libraires must be installed. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features to
content: DocumentationGetting startedLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01Getting Started Welcome to the Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC ! This SDK provides additional services / features to the Rainbow CSharp SDK (core) library. So you need first to understand how to use it. Nuget package The SDK is provided as a Nuget package available here This package targets .Net Standard 2.0, .Net Standard 2.1, .Net Core 6.0 and .Net 8.0 WebRTC features Permits to manage WebRTC communications: Peer To Peer or in a Conference using Rainbow environment (https://developers.openrainbow.com/home) Peer To Peer communication features: Answer, Decline, Make, Retract, Hang up call Add / Remove Video or Sharing Mute / Unmute Audio, Video or Sharing Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Output is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Conference features: Start, Join Conference Participants list Publishers list Mute / Unmute: current user but also other Peers if current user is a moderator of the conference Call status: Ringing incoming, ringing outgoing, in progress, ... Display Active Talker. Current user of this SDK is never seen as Active Talker (work still in progress) Add / Remove Video or Sharing Subscribe (automatically or manualy) to publication of Peers (Video or Sharing) Request / Refuse / Accept Sharing transfert Conference delegation Audio Stream: Output and Input are supported Video Stream: Ouput is supported. Input is not supported (work still in progress) Abstractions and Implementations This package use abstractions to offer those WebRTC features based on specific implementations. For the moment, two implementations are available: Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Desktop Third library used: SIPSorcery, FFmpeg libraries and SDL2 Comptatible Windows, MacOs and Linux platforms Rainbow CSharp SDK WebRTC.Unity Available only in private access for the moment Third library used: Unity and WebRTC for Unity Comptatible with Windows, MacOs and Linux, Android, iOS platforms Developping with the Rainbow.WebRTC SDK Quick overview on how to use the Rainbow.WebRTC sdk to develop a webrtc enabled application. It is intended to be about general principles and is not specific to the implementation. For specific, check documentation of he implementation you want to use. Instantiation Create a Rainbow.Application object Rainbow Application myApp = new Rainbow.Application(); Configure application credentials and platform Enable restrictions on Conferences Monitor ConnectionStateChanged and InitializationPerformed Call Login() The SDK will try to connect to the platform using the supplied (application and user) credentials. If it failed you are informed in the optional callback. When it's done initializing and retrieving informations it will raise the InitializationPerformed signal. At this stage the SDK can be used. If your application makes use of bubbles or conferences, when InitializationPerformed is received it should call Bubbles.GetAllBubbles(). It is the right time to instantiate a WebRTCCommunications object, which will make it possible make calls or join conference. You can find more informations about the Rainbow SDK Here. This quick diagram summarizes how to initialize an application who would use WebRTCCommunications. Events in WebRTCCommunications The most importants events to handle to issue webrtc calls in your applications are CallUpdated , MediaPublicationUpdated and OnTrack. When a user receives a call, or is issuing the call, the WebRTCCommunications class informs him of the progression of the call using the CallUpdated events. The event provides you with an instance of the Call class, containing many useful information like The status The local and remote medias established on the call The participants The call Id which is needed to perform actions on this calls, like decline the call, hangup, publish some medias.. The other important event to handle is MediaPublicationUpdated. This happens each time a local or remote media is added to the call. A MediaPublicationUpdated event provides a MediaPublication object which can be used to subscribe to a MediaPublication using the method WebRTCCommunications.SubscribeToMediaPublication. Calling this method means that your application is interested in this media. If you subscribe to a media publication WebRTCommunications will send you the associated MediaStreamTrack using OnTrack event. Making Calls and Receiving Calls Here is a simplified (and incomplete) diagram showing how to use WebRTCCommunications events and methods to establish an audio Peer to peer call, using the MakeCall method. When another user calls your application, WebRTCCommunications emits a CallUpdated with a CallStatus of RINGING_INCOMING . To accept the call use WebRTCCommunications.AnswerCall, and to decline use WebRTCCommunications.RejectCall. What happens after AnswerCall is similar to what

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01ComparerSDK.WebRTC for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Changed .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.
content: DocumentationChangelogLTS release 1.XPubliée le 2024-07-01ComparerSDK.WebRTC for C# [1.0.0] - 2024-07-01 Changed .Net 6.0 as target plateform has been removed (obsolete). .Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 8.0 are still in targets platform. [0.0.15-STS] - 2024-05-27 Changed Breaking WebRTCCommunications: Add parameter subStreamLevel in `SubscribeToMediaPublication()' [0.0.14-STS] - 2024-03-19 Added DataChannel: new class - before a IDataChannel interface was used DataChannel.Close(): permits to unsubscribe to remote DataChannel or To remove DataChannel of the current user DataChannelDescriptor: new class MediaStreamTrackDescriptor: IsMediaService property WebRTCCommunications: CanSubscribeToMediaService(), IsSubscribedToMediaService(), SubscribeToMediaService(), UnsubscribeToMediaService(), GetMediaServicesSubscribed() and GetMediaServicesAvailable() methods WebRTCCommunications: HoldMediaPublication(), HoldMediaService(), GetTracks() and GetDataChannels() methods WebRTCCommunications: OnMediaServiceUpdated event Fixed WebRTCCommunications: avoid crash in GetOrCreateInstance() when simultaneous bots are used WebRTCCommunications: Update medias currenlty used (local or remote) before OnMediaPublicationUpdated event is raised Changed Breaking DataChannelInCallDelegate: Signature changed to use a DataChannelDescriptor [0.0.13-STS] - 2024-01-15 Added Add .Net 8.0 as target plateform (.Net Std 2.0, 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still in targets platform) .Net 6.0 target platform will be removed in April. (Alpha support) Allow to manage DataChannel in a Conference . Only one DataChannel can be created for the moment by user but several can be subscribed. Fixed PeerConnection are closed/disposed in a better way in P2P and Conference, media status are set correctly: SendRecv, SendOnly, RecvOnly, Inactive [0.0.12-STS] - 2023-12-08 Fixed WebRTCCommunications: Event CallUpdated could be not raised if a media was added or removed in conference by a remote peer [0.0.11-STS] - 2023-09-05 Changed Use last version of SDK.Medias to use FFmpeg v6.0 libraries WebRTCCommunications: Allow to set ConfigurationOptions object in MakeCall(), AnswerCall(), StartAndJoinConference(), JoinConference(), AddVideo(), AddSharing(), AddDataChannel() [0.0.10] - STS - 2023-07-07 Enhancements Allow to suscribe to dynamic feed (i.e. to see in one stream the active talker if he's using its web cam): DynamicFeed property (new) in MediaPublication object must be set to true when SubscribeToMediaPublication is used to subscribe to video media publication. Once subscription is done, event OnTrack is raised. Then the DynamicFeed property (new) of MediaStreamTrackDescriptor object permits to know that this track contains the dynamic feed. Framework targets .Net Core App 3.1 is no more targetted (already deprecated by Microsoft). .Net Standardd 2.0 / 2.1 and .Net 6.0 are still targetted [0.0.9] - STS - 2023-05-26 Fix: Test to check if Video subscription must be done was incorrect In Conference, when sharing is added, a session-initiate is received. We have to send session-terminate if we don't subscribe to it. In Conference: Subscribe/Unsubscribe on Media before/after the join is now well managed. In P2P, Video and Sharing stream from remote are handled faster Correclty handle stream status to create a valid SDP Enhancements: Architecture has been reworked to build a common library compatible with a Desktop WebRTC implementation and Unity WebRTC implementation. The Desktop WebRTC implementation is equivalent in term of features, dependencies and target platform as the previous version of this library: - Based on SipSorcery, FFmpeg and SDL2 - Target Windows, MacOS and Linux The Unity WebRTC implementation permits to use Rainbow SDK C# with WebRTC features in a Unity project - Unity use the WebRTC implementation provided by the Chromium project. - Unity targets Android, iOS but also Windows, Mac, Linux, Extended Reality devices (XR), Consoles (PS5, XBox, Switch), WebGL It was necessary to create a new package called Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions which provide objects and interfaces to inherit / use to be compatible with this new package architecture. To provide Desktop WebRTC implementation, a new Nuget package, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Desktop, implements interfaces and use objects defined in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions. To provide Unity WebRTC implementation, a new Unity package, Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Unity, implements interfaces and use objects defined in Rainbow.CSharp.SDK.WebRTC.Abstractions. This package is not yet available publicly but it has been tested with success on Android and some XR devices There is no more media or device management in this package. It's done in each implementation since it's specific for each. [0.0.8] - STS - 2023-02-10 Thanks to new version of the SDK C# Medias, it's now possible to decode incoming media (Audio, Video and Sharing ) from P2P call or Conference call. Connecting state is now correctly managed to av

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: SDK Rainbow pour le WebLe choix parfait pour votre site Web ou votre application WebPrêt à commencer avec le SDK Rainbow pour le Web ?Tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow po
content: SDK Rainbow pour le WebLe choix parfait pour votre site Web ou votre application WebPrêt à commencer avec le SDK Rainbow pour le Web ?Tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour démarrer avec le SDK Rainbow pour le Web.Premiers pas avec le SDK WebTélécharger le SDK WebConsulter les kits de démarrage WebInformations pratiquesVersion: Publiée: Dernière mise à jour: Consulter le journal des modificationsBasculer vers la documentation STSIntégration facile à votre site WebLe SDK Rainbow pour le Web s'intègre facilement dans n'importe quel site Web ou application Web en ajoutant simplement quelques lignes de code. Une fois cela fait, votre site Web ou votre application sera connecté à Rainbow et capable d'utiliser tous les services Rainbow disponibles.Pour n'importe quel navigateurPour tout appareil ou système d'exploitationPour tout framework JSOffre une console de débogage convivialeUn SDK Web entièrement documentéLe SDK Rainbow pour le Web vous fournit les meilleurs services pour vous connecter à Rainbow et s'intégrer à votre site. Ces services ont été soigneusement développés et sont bien documentés avec les détails nécessaires pour vous aider à créer votre application.Des fonctionnalités de collaborations complètesLe SDK Rainbow pour le Web fournit les services dont vous avez besoin pour créer un réseau social complet. Faites de votre site une machine à relations. Discutez ou partagez des fichiers avec un seul destinataire ou avec un groupe. Passez un appel audio avec quelqu'un, ajoutez la vidéo. C'est très simple avec Rainbow !SDK Rainbow pour le Web en un coup d'œil.Découvrez les principaux services fournis par ce SDKSimple bibliothèque JSChargez le fichier JavaScript du SDK Rainbow à partir de votre site Web ou de votre application et utilisez-le avec quelques lignes de code. Il est compatible avec les principaux frameworks JavaScript tels que React, Angular et JQuery.Service de contacts, de recherche et de présenceGérez votre liste de contacts et sachez quand ils sont disponibles, occupés au téléphone ou absents et donc quand vous pouvez les joindre. Recherchez des utilisateurs par nom ou identifiant pour étendre votre réseau.Service de messagerie instantanée en tête-à-têteSoyez notifié des messages entrants des utilisateurs, acquittez-les et envoyez des réponses à vos destinataires. Vous pouvez récupérer l'intégralité de la conversation ou uniquement les messages les plus récents.Service de conversation de groupe (bulles)Créez et invitez des utilisateurs, ou reutilisez vos Bulles afin de discuter ensemble. Dans une Bulle, tout le monde peut participer à la conversation.Service WebRTC audio et vidéoVous pouvez lancer des appels audio et vidéo vers vos contacts en utilisant votre navigateur sans plug-in. Ajoutez la vidéo à un appel audio. Choisissez l'appareil que vous souhaitez utiliser et contrôlez l'appel (activez/désactivez le son).Service de conférence WebRTCVous pouvez vous connecter aux conférences téléphoniques dans une bulle. Contrôlez la vidéo que vous souhaitez voir et contrôlez votre appareil (activez/désactivez le son).Service de partage de fichiersPartagez des fichiers avec un utilisateur dans le cadre d'une conversation Rainbow en "tête-à-tête" ou au sein d'une bulle Rainbow avec plusieurs participants. Téléchargez des fichiers partagés par d'autres dans l'espace de stockage cloud de Rainbow.Service de groupesRegroupez vos contacts par activité, autres,... . Faites de certains groupes vos groupes favoris.Service de téléphonie PSTNVous pouvez lancer un appel ou répondre à n'importe quel appel avec votre téléphone PBX. Le service couvre toutes les fonctionnalités de base de la téléphonie, telles que la mise en attente et la récupération d'un appel, le renvoi d'un appel vers la messagerie vocale, la tenue d'une conférence téléphonique avec plusieurs participants, etc.Service de chaînes d'informationEnvoyez des messages aux chaînes d'information qui peuvent être souscrites par des milliers d'utilisateurs. Abonnez-vous aux chaînes d'information publiques d'autres utilisateurs pour les suivre et recevoir ce qu'ils publient!Liens intéressantsApprendre à utiliser nos SDKsBesoin d'aide?Contactez notre équipe supportVisitez notre page d'accueilFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationBubbles serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Bubbles This service manages multi-party communications in Rainbow (aka bubbles). Bubbles allow to chat and to share files with sever
content: DocumentationBubbles serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Bubbles This service manages multi-party communications in Rainbow (aka bubbles). Bubbles allow to chat and to share files with several participants. Each user can create bubbles and invite other Rainbow users to be part of it. Without being invited, users can join a bubble. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Create new bubbles, - Invite and manage participants in your bubbles - Accept or decline invites received from bubbles - Leave, close or remove your bubbles Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEINVITATIONTOJOINRECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEAVATARUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONBUBBLEDEACTIVATED Access: public Bubbles createBubble(strName, strDescription, boolWithHistory, disableNotifications, urlAvatar, autoAcceptInvitation) ⇒ Promise deleteBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise deleteAllBubbles() ⇒ Promise inviteContactToBubble(contactId, bubble, boolAsModerator, boolWithInvitation) ⇒ Promise removeContactFromBubble(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise promoteContactToModerator(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise demoteContactFromModerator(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise changeOwner(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise acceptInvitationToJoinBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise declineInvitationToJoinBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise leaveBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise closeBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise isBubbleArchived(bubble) ⇒ boolean getAllBubbles() ⇒ Array getAllOwnedBubbles() ⇒ Array getAllPendingBubbles() ⇒ Array getAllInactiveBubbles() ⇒ Array getBubbleById(strBubbleId) ⇒ Array updateNameForBubble(strName, bubble) ⇒ Promise updateDescriptionForBubble(strDescription, bubble) ⇒ Promise updateBubbleConfiguration(bubble, muteUponEntry, roomName, roomDescription) ⇒ Promise updateAvatarForBubble(urlAvatar, bubble) ⇒ Promise deleteAvatarFromBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise updateCustomDataForBubble(customData, bubble) ⇒ Promise deleteCustomDataForBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise getBubbleFromServer(bubble) ⇒ Promise createPublicUrl(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise retrievePublicUrl(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise joinBubbleUsingPublicUrl(publicUrl) ⇒ Promise reactivateInactiveBubble(bubbleId) ⇒ Promise bubbles.createBubble(strName, strDescription, boolWithHistory, disableNotifications, urlAvatar, autoAcceptInvitation) ⇒ Promise Create a new bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - The bubble object or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription strNamestringThe name of the bubble strDescriptionstringThe description of the bubble. Defaults to an empty string. boolWithHistorybooleanTrue to have full messages history for newcomers. Defaults to false. disableNotificationsbooleanWhen set to true, there is no more notifications to be sent by a room in all cases with text body (user join/leave, conference start/end). Defaults to false. urlAvatarstringThe avatar Url or null (in case of invalid url or image it may fail). Defaults to null. autoAcceptInvitationbooleanSet to 'true' to automatically invite other users to the bubble (without asking them to accept the invitation). Defaults to false. bubbles.deleteBubble(bubble) ⇒ Promise Delete an existing owned bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - Nothing or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription bubbleobjectThe bubble to remove bubbles.deleteAllBubbles() ⇒ Promise Delete all existing owned bubbles Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - Nothing or an error object depending on the result Access: public bubbles.inviteContactToBubble(contactId, bubble, boolAsModerator, boolWithInvitation) ⇒ Promise Invite a contact to a bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - The bubble object or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringID of the contact to invite bubbleobjectThe destination bubble boolAsModeratorbooleanTrue to invite a contact as a moderator (false by default) boolWithInvitationbooleanTrue to send an invitation or false to add someone directly in a bubble (true by default) bubbles.removeContactFromBubble(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise Remove a contact from a bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - The bubble object or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringID of the contact to remove bubbleobjectThe destination bubble bubbles.promoteContactToModerator(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise Promote a contact to moderator in a bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - The bubble object or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringID of the contact to promote bubbleobjectThe destination bubble bubbles.demoteContactFromModerator(contactId, bubble) ⇒ Promise Demote a contact to user role in a bubble Kind: instance method of Bubbles Returns: Promise - The bubble object or an error object depending on the result Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstrin

A call is a "short" interaction between the user and one or several contacts (Rainbow users or not) that uses either a WebRTC media (audio, video or screen sharing) or a Telephony media (PBX phone). No Rainbow users such as external users can only be engaged into a Telephony call. A call is always attached to a conversation. call.globalCallId Kind: instance property of Call Access: public Read only: true Properties NameTypeDescription globalCallIdstringa global id when the call content: DocumentationCallsLog serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 CallsLog This service allow to get the call log and manage it. The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Get all calls log - Delete one or all calls log - Mark calls as read / unread Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGACKUPDATED Access: public CallsLog fetchCallLogs(numberOfCallLogs) ⇒ Promise fetchPaginatedCallLogs(numberOfElementsPerPage) ⇒ Promise getMissedCallLogCounter() ⇒ number getMissedCallLogNumber() ⇒ number deleteOneCallLog(id) ⇒ boolean deleteCallLogsForContact(jid) ⇒ boolean deleteAllCallLogs() ⇒ void markCallLogAsRead(id) ⇒ void markAllCallsLogsAsRead() ⇒ void isInitialized() ⇒ boolean callsLog.fetchCallLogs(numberOfCallLogs) ⇒ Promise Get the Call-logs for current user; If this is the first time, the API will load the latest 'numberOfCallLogs' entries for this user Otherwise it will give all the available already loaded call-logs for this user; The user is able to ask for more call-logs via fetchPaginatedCallLogs API; Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: Promise - Promise with an array of call log entry Access: public ParamTypeDescription numberOfCallLogsnumberSpecify number of call logs to fetch from the server. Defaults to 100. (max value allowed 250) callsLog.fetchPaginatedCallLogs(numberOfElementsPerPage) ⇒ Promise Get all available call-logs already loaded + the new fetched from the server Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: Promise - Promise with an array of call log entry Access: public ParamTypeDescription numberOfElementsPerPagenumberSpecify number of call logs to fetch from the server. Defaults to 100. (max value allowed 250) callsLog.getMissedCallLogCounter() ⇒ number Get the number of call missed (state === "missed" && direction === "incoming") Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: number - The number of call missed Access: public callsLog.getMissedCallLogNumber() ⇒ number Get the number of call missed (state === "missed" && direction === "incoming") You can call this method before retrieving all the callLogs from the server (by using fetch) Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: number - The number of call missed Access: public callsLog.deleteOneCallLog(id) ⇒ boolean Delete a call log from it's id You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: boolean - true Access: public ParamTypeDescription idstringThe call log id to remove callsLog.deleteCallLogsForContact(jid) ⇒ boolean Delete all calls log items associated to a contact's given jid You have to listen to event RAINBOW_ONCALLLOGUPDATED to know when the action is finished Kind: instance method of CallsLog Returns: boolean - excerpt: DocumentationChannel modelLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Channel Channel model. Channel ~id : string ~name : string ~visibility : string ~topic : string ~creatorId : string ~companyId : string
content: DocumentationChannel modelLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Channel Channel model. Channel ~id : string ~name : string ~visibility : string ~topic : string ~creatorId : string ~companyId : string ~creationDate : Date ~usersCount : number ~avatar : string ~lastAvatarUpdateDate : Date ~userRole : string ~messages : Array ~subscribed : boolean ~delted : boolean ~invited : boolean ~category : string ~users : Array ~subscribersCount : number ~messagesCount : number Channel~id : string ID of the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~name : string Channel name Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~visibility : string Channel visibility. There are three possible options: "private" (only the owner may publish messages, add or remove users), "company" (company users may join or leave, may be found by searching by the users in the same company) or "public" (may be found by all the users, only allowed users can create a public channel). Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~topic : string Channel topic Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~creatorId : string Creator ID Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~companyId : string ID of the company that the channel is attached to Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~creationDate : Date Channel's creation date Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~usersCount : number Channel users count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~avatar : string Channel avatar Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~lastAvatarUpdateDate : Date Last avatar update date Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~userRole : string User role - can be one of the following values: 'none', 'owner', 'publisher' or 'member' Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~messages : Array Messages published to the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~subscribed : boolean Boolean representing the current subscription state. Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~delted : boolean Boolean indicating whether the channel has been deleted Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~invited : boolean Boolean indicating whether the user has been invited to subscribe to the channel Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~category : string Channel category Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~users : Array Channel users Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~subscribersCount : number Channel subscribers count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Channel~messagesCount : number Channel messages count Kind: inner property of Channel Access: public Read only: true Sur cette pageChannelChannel~id : stringChannel~name : stringChannel~visibility : stringChannel~topic : stringChannel~creatorId : stringChannel~companyId : stringChannel~creationDate : DateChannel~usersCount : numberChannel~avatar : stringChannel~lastAvatarUpdateDate : DateChannel~userRole : stringChannel~messages : ArrayChannel~subscribed : booleanChannel~delted : booleanChannel~invited : booleanChannel~category : stringChannel~users : ArrayChannel~subscribersCount : numberChannel~messagesCount : numberCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationChannels serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Channels This service gives access to channels in Rainbow. It is a Publish–subscribe pattern implementation Rainbow users can create
content: DocumentationChannels serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Channels This service gives access to channels in Rainbow. It is a Publish–subscribe pattern implementation Rainbow users can create channels. Currently, there is a configuration limit for max_items=100 and a source code limit for max_payload_size=60000 bytes The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Get all channels owned by an user - Find a channel, get a channel, if owned modify it - Subscribe/Unsubscribe to a channel (you are not automatically subscried to a channel you own) - Publish a message to a channel - Manage users in a channel you own Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELMESSAGERECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELDELETED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELRETRACTMESSAGERECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELAVATARUPDATED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUSERSUBSCRIBED, event:RAINBOW_ONCHANNELUSERUNSUBSCRIBED Channels fetchMyChannels() ⇒ Promise createPublicChannel(channelName, channelTopic, category) ⇒ Promise createClosedChannel(channelName, [channelTopic], [category]) ⇒ Promise deleteChannel(id) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByName([name]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByTopic([topic]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannelsByCategory([category]) ⇒ Promise fetchChannel(id) ⇒ Promise createItem(channelId, message, [title], [itemType]) ⇒ Promise subscribeToChannelById(id) ⇒ Promise subscribeToChannel(channel) ⇒ Promise unsubscribeFromChannelById(id) ⇒ Promise unsubscribeFromChannel(channel) ⇒ Promise updateChannel(id, [channelTopic], [visibility], [maxItems], [maxPayloadSize], [channelName], [category]) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibility(id, visibility) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibilityToPublic(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelVisibilityToClosed(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelName(id, channelName) ⇒ Promise updateChannelTopic(id, channelTopic) ⇒ Promise updateChannelCategory(id, category) ⇒ Promise updateChannelAvatar(id, urlAvatar) ⇒ Promise deleteChannelAvatar(id) ⇒ Promise fetchUsers(id, [options]) ⇒ Promise deleteAllUsersFromChannel(id) ⇒ Promise updateChannelUsers(id, users, [userType]) ⇒ Promise addMembersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise addPublishersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise addOwnersToChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise deleteUsersFromChannel(id, users) ⇒ Promise fetchItems(id, [maxMessages], [beforeDate], [afterDate]) ⇒ Promise deleteItem(id, itemId) ⇒ Promise channels.fetchMyChannels() ⇒ Promise Get the channels you own, are subscribed to or are publisher of Kind: instance method of Channels Returns: Promise - Return a list of channels or an empty array if no channel has been found Access: public channels.createPublicChannel(channelName, channelTopic, category) ⇒ Promise Create a public channel Kind: instance method of Channels Returns: Promise - Promise containing a new channel object or an error Access: public ParamTypeDescription channelNamestringThe name of the channel channelTopicstringThe topic of the channel categorystringThe category of the channel channels.createClosedChannel(channelName, [channelTopic], [category]) ⇒ Promise Create a closed channel Kind: instance method of Channels Returns: Promise - Promise containing the title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConfig serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Config This service allows more fine-grained control over the behavior of particular components of the Rainbow Web SDK. You can set th
content: DocumentationConfig serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Config This service allows more fine-grained control over the behavior of particular components of the Rainbow Web SDK. You can set the log levels, video stream qualty and more. Config setSimulcast(value) ⇒ boolean setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ string setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ boolean useNewModels(value) ⇒ boolean setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ string setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ void setAutoAway(value) ⇒ void setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ void getCurrentConfig() ⇒ object config.setSimulcast(value) ⇒ boolean Set Simulcast feature. When turned on, the broadcasting user sends few streams of varying quality during the conference and a WebRTC one-to-one call. It can increase the consumption of bandwidth for the connected user. Turn off to send one stream with fixed quality. When simulcast is turned off you can use setVideoQuality() API to chose the video quality. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to turn on, false to turn off config.setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ string Set the video quality of the broadcasted video stream. The Simulcast feature needs to be turned off for the quality settings to be taken into account. User can chose between three levels: "low" - corresponding to 180p, "middle" - 360p and "high" - 720p. The exact resolution of the video stream depends on user's camera model and firmware. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: string - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuestringValue representing the video quality. Can be one of the following values: "low", "middle" or "high" config.setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ boolean Allows to have verbose logs when using the SDK Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate verbose log. False to deactivate it config.useNewModels(value) ⇒ boolean Starting v1.86.0, the new models of different data have been introduced (contact, conversation...). Set to false to use the previous version of the models. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: boolean - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate new models. False to deactivate it config.setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ string Set display order information attached to the contacts. It be one of the two values: "FL" or "LF". Can also be set via config object used in load() method. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: string - Return the input value Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuestringDisplay order: "FL" (first name, last name) or "LF" (last name, first name) config.setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ void Set custom logger. Allows the user to pass custom logging method. Custom logger should accept strings as parameter. Defaults to false. setVerboseLog config parameter should be set to true in order for the customLogger to be activated. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription loggeranyAny logger solution accepting the following format: customLogger(sdkMessageString) config.setAutoAway(value) ⇒ void Change auto away settings. By default, Rainbow will set connected user's presence to 'away' after 180 seconds. This setting lets the user to disable that feature. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuebooleanTrue to activate autoAway (default), false to allow presence changing only manually config.setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ void Change auto away delay settings. By default, Rainbow will set connected user's presence to 'away' after 180 seconds. This setting lets the user to change the delay after which the presence will be changed to 'away'. If the autoAway feature is deactivated, setting any delay above 0 will reactivate it again. Kind: instance method of Config Returns: void - Returns void Access: public ParamTypeDescription valuenumberTime of delay in seconds (defaults to 180s). Set to 0 to deactivate the autoAway feature and set the delay value to 0. config.getCurrentConfig() ⇒ object Get current configuration file Kind: instance method of Config Returns: object - Current config settings Access: public Sur cette pageConfigconfig.setSimulcast(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.setVideoQuality(value) ⇒ stringconfig.setVerboseLog(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.useNewModels(value) ⇒ booleanconfig.setDisplayOrder(value) ⇒ stringconfig.setCustomLogger(logger) ⇒ voidconfig.setAutoAway(value) ⇒ voidconfig.setAutoAwayDelay(value) ⇒ voidconfig.getCurrentConfig() ⇒ objectCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbo

content: DocumentationConnection serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Connection This service connects the user to Rainbow and listen to the connection state change. The main methods or events proposed in that service allow to: - Sign-in to Rainbow, - Sign-out from Rainbow, - Listen to the connection state change with Rainbow to discover if the platform is accessible or not, - Listen to the SDK for Web loading state change for handling when the SDK can be used Please find the table of error return codes for Sign-in {result.code} below - 1, Ok - -1, Error - -2, Unauthorized - -4, Error on event socket - -8, Id error on event socket - -16, Bad request - -32, Unsupported - -64, Not found Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCONNECTIONSTATECHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONSTARTED, event:RAINBOW_ONSTOPPED, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENRENEW, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENRENEWFAILED, event:RAINBOW_ONUSERTOKENWILLEXPIRE, event:RAINBOW_ONAPPTOKENRENEW, event:RAINBOW_ONAPPTOKENRENEWFAILED Connection signin(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowOfficial(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowBeta(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowCPaasPreProd(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowDev(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowSandboxChina(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowChina(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowHosted(strLogin, strPassword, strHost) ⇒ object signinSandBoxWithToken(strToken) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowOfficialWithToken(strToken) ⇒ Promise signinOnRainbowBetaWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowDevWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object signinOnRainbowHostedWithToken(strToken, strHost) ⇒ object signinWithToken(strToken) ⇒ object setRenewedToken(strToken) ⇒ void signinOnRainbowWithOICD(strToken) ⇒ object styleSignInWithRainbowButton(color, size) ⇒ boolean signout() ⇒ Promise updateUserPassword(oldPassword, newPassword) ⇒ Promise getState() ⇒ string getToken() ⇒ string refreshToken() ⇒ Promise connection.signin(strLogin, strPassword) ⇒ Promise Allow to sign-in to Rainbow Sandbox environment from a Rainbow Sandbox user account that already exists The Rainbow Sandbox environment will be used to access the Rainbow Cloud Services Kind: instance method of Connection Returns: Promise - content: DocumentationContact modelLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Contact This class is used to represent a contact or the connected user. A contact is defined by a set of public information (name, firstname, avatar) and a set of private information that are only shared with contacts that are in the user's network or in the same company (email, phone numbers) Contact ~id : string ~status : string ~loginEmail : string ~email : string ~lastname : string ~firstname : string ~fullname : string ~nickname : string ~initials : string ~title : string ~jobTitle : string ~language : string ~country : string ~tags : Array ~internalPhoneNumber : string ~professionalPhoneNumber : string ~personalPhoneNumber : string ~personalMobilePhoneNumber : string ~professionalMobileNumber : string ~professionalMobileNumberCan : string ~voicemailNumber : string ~roles : Array ~customData : object ~pbxId : string ~displayOrder : string ~avatar : string ~userInfo1 : object ~userInfo2 : object ~company : object ~businessPhones : object ~mobilePhones : object ~isAlertNotificationEnabled : object ~calendarInformation : object ~fileSharingEnabled : boolean ~fileStorageEnabled : boolean ~instantMessagesEnabled : boolean ~bubblesEnabled : boolean ~webrtcAudioEnabled : boolean ~webrtcVideoEnabled : boolean ~webrtcSharingEnabled : boolean ~modifyProfileEnabled : boolean Contact~id : string Contact ID. This is a global reference of the contact, can be used as a parameter passed to multiple Rainbow Web SDK APIs Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~status : string Contact status. Can be one of the following values: "online", "dnd", "offline" or "unknown" Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~loginEmail : string Login email of the contact Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~email : string Email address associated with the account Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~lastname : string Contact's last name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~firstname : string Contact's first name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~fullname : string Contact's full name Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~nickname : string Contact's nickname Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~initials : string Contact's initials Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~title : string Contact's title Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~jobTitle : string Contact's job title Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~language : string Contact's language Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~country : string Contact's country Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~tags : Array Array of tags associated to the contact Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~internalPhoneNumber : string Contact's internal phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalPhoneNumber : string Contact's professional phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~personalPhoneNumber : string Contact's personal phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~personalMobilePhoneNumber : string Contact's personal mobile phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalMobileNumber : string Contact's professional mobile phone number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~professionalMobileNumberCan : string Contact's professional mobile phone number (in canonical format) Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~voicemailNumber : string Contact's voice mail number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~roles : Array Contact's voice mail number Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~customData : object Custom data of the user. An object of custom properties that can be changed by company admin. Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~pbxId : string ID of the PBX associated with the user Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~displayOrder : string Indicator for the display order. Can be set to either "FL" (first name, last name) or "LF" (last name, first name) Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~avatar : string Source of the avatar (if any). Null if none. Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~userInfo1 : object Custom data attached to the user, can be modified by admin Kind: inner property of Contact Access: public Read only: true Contact~userIn

content: DocumentationContacts serviceLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 Contacts This service gives access to the information of the connected user and to all of his contacts. In addition, this service manages the network of the connected user through invitations The main methods and events proposed in that service allow to: - Retrieve the user connected information including his associated PBX phone if registered, - Retrieve the contacts information, - Search for contacts on the server, - Invite contacts, manage invitations, - Manage own contact list (roster), - Listen to the contacts information changes to be able to update your application if needed, - Listen to invitations coming from contacts Emits: event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINFORMATIONCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONINFORMATIONCHANGED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINVITATIONRECEIVED, event:RAINBOW_ONCONTACTINVITATIONNUMBERCHANGED Contacts getContactByJID(strJID) ⇒ object getContactById(contactId) ⇒ Promise getNetworkContacts() ⇒ Promise getAll() ⇒ Array getConnectedUser() ⇒ object getConnectedUserPhone() ⇒ object searchByName(strName, limit, addRosters, companyId, excludeCompanyId) ⇒ Promise searchPhonebook(strPattern) ⇒ Promise searchOffice365(strPattern) ⇒ Promise searchCompanyDirectory(strPattern, companyId) ⇒ Promise searchByLogin(strLogin) ⇒ Promise searchByJid(strJid) ⇒ Promise searchById(strId) ⇒ Promise acceptInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise declineInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise addToNetwork(contactId) ⇒ Promise sendInvitationByEmail(email, customMessage) ⇒ Promise removeFromNetwork(contactId) ⇒ Promise getInvitationById(invitationId) ⇒ object getInvitationsReceived() ⇒ Array cancelInvitation(invitationId) ⇒ Promise getInvitationsSent() ⇒ Array updateUserCustomData(customData) ⇒ Promise updateUserAutoDndCalendarSetting(activate) ⇒ Promise getUserAutoDndCalendarSetting() ⇒ boolean updateUserMSTeamsPresenceSetting(activate) ⇒ Promise getUserMSTeamsPresenceSetting() ⇒ boolean isCalendarSharingActivated() ⇒ boolean contacts.getContactByJID(strJID) ⇒ object Deprecated Get a contact by his JID locally from the network or from opened conversations. If the contact is not found, you can call the searchByJID() method to try to find it on server side. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Return a Contact object representing the contact information or null if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription strJIDstringThe JID of the contact to get contacts.getContactById(contactId) ⇒ Promise Get a contact by his ID (dbId) locally from the network or from opened conversations. If the contact is not found, you can call the searchById() method to try to find him on server side. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - Return a promise containing a contact object representing the contact information or null if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription contactIdstringThe ID of the contact to get contacts.getNetworkContacts() ⇒ Promise Returns a list of contacts that are in the network of the connected user Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found or an empty array if no contact has been found Access: public contacts.getAll() ⇒ Array Returns a list of users. It includes the contacts that are in the network of the connected user and the contacts that the connected user has opened conversation with. Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Array - Array of Contact object Access: public contacts.getConnectedUser() ⇒ object Get the connected user information Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Contact object representing the connected user information or null if not connected Access: public contacts.getConnectedUserPhone() ⇒ object Get the connected user phone information or null if not exists Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: object - Object containing phoneNumber and pbxId keys Access: public contacts.searchByName(strName, limit, addRosters, companyId, excludeCompanyId) ⇒ Promise Search for a contact by name or firstname on the server. Depending the privacy rules, you can receive more or less information for each contact. Please refer to Rainbow for Developers privacy Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found or an empty array if no contact has been found Access: public ParamTypeDescription strNamestringThe beginning of the name or the first name to search limitnumberoptional, allow to specify the maximum number of contacts to retrieve. 20 by default. A maximum of 1000 results can be retrieved. addRostersboolean[optional] whether or not to include our contact roster in the search. Default: false companyIdstringID of company to search. Default = "" excludeCompanyIdstringID of company to search. Default = "" contacts.searchPhonebook(strPattern) ⇒ Promise Search for a contact in your Phonebook Kind: instance method of Contacts Returns: Promise - A promise with an array of contacts found o

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConversation modelLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 ConversationSDK Conversation model. Conversation is a representation of an interaction between a Rainbow user and another user, bu
content: DocumentationConversation modelLTS release 4.0.0Publiée le 2022-12-21 ConversationSDK Conversation model. Conversation is a representation of an interaction between a Rainbow user and another user, bubble or a call. A conversation never ends and all interactions done can be retrieved. ConversationSDK ~id : string ~type : number ~contactId : string ~bubbleId : string ~name : string ~name : string ~creationDate : Date ~lastModificiationDate : Date ~isFavorite : boolean ~messages : string ~lastMessage : string ConversationSDK~id : string The ID of the conversation. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~type : number The type of the conversation. Value 0 refers to one-to-one conversation, 1 to a bubble conversation and 2 to a call. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~contactId : string ID of the associated contact. In case of bubble conversation the value will default to 'null'. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~bubbleId : string ID of the bubble that the conversation is linked to, if any present. In case of one-to-one conversation the value will default to 'null'. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~name : string Name of the conversation - if conversation is of one-to-one type. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~name : string Name of a bubble, if the conversation is attached to a bubble. Otherwise, defaults to null. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~creationDate : Date Creation date of the conversation Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~lastModificiationDate : Date Last modification date (i.e. the date of the last message) Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~isFavorite : boolean Boolean indicating whether the conversation belongs to the user's favorites Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~messages : string An array representing the messages sent in the conversation Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true ConversationSDK~lastMessage : string The content of the last message sent in the conversation. Kind: inner property of ConversationSDK Access: public Read only: true Sur cette pageConversationSDKConversationSDK~id : stringConversationSDK~type : numberConversationSDK~contactId : stringConversationSDK~bubbleId : stringConversationSDK~name : stringConversationSDK~name : stringConversationSDK~creationDate : DateConversationSDK~lastModificiationDate : DateConversationSDK~isFavorite : booleanConversationSDK~messages : stringConversationSDK~lastMessage : stringCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur
