excerpt: DocumentationCallLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / Call Interface: Call Properties callStatus readonly callStatus: CallStatus Call telephone status capabil
content: DocumentationCallLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / Call Interface: Call Properties callStatus readonly callStatus: CallStatus Call telephone status capabilities readonly capabilities: CallCapabilities Capabilities of the call contact readonly contact: User The user reference representing the other party (as caller or callee) engaged in this call direction direction: CallDirection Call direction This information is relevant only for telephone (PBX) call. For WebRTC call it is undefined. duration readonly duration: number Call duration in seconds localMedias readonly localMedias: CallMediaStreams The local medias currently in the call networkQuality readonly networkQuality: number The current network quality (0 - bad, 1 - medium, 2 - good) for the call remoteMedias readonly remoteMedias: CallMediaStreams The remote medias currently in the call subject readonly subject: string On an incoming call, contains the subject of the call if this has been specified by the caller type readonly type: CallType The type of the call (WebRTC or Telephony) Methods addAudio() addAudio(): Promise<void> Add the AUDIO media to the current call. This feature can be used only if the "addAudio" call capability is 'True' and available only for WebRTC Calls. Returns Promise<void> addParticipantsToCall() addParticipantsToCall(participants): Promise<Conversation> Add participants to the the current call. This feature can be used only if the "addParticipantsToCall" call capability is 'True'. The participants could be other Rainbow users or phone numbers (if the PBX system supports it). This will result in a new conversation being created with web conference inside. The active call will be "transferred" to the bubble conference; Parameters • participants: CallDestination[] The list of participants to be added to the call Returns Promise<Conversation> The new bubble conversation where the web conference is active addSharing() addSharing(): Promise<void> Add the SHARING media to the current call. This feature can be used only if the "addSharing" call capability is 'True' and available only for WebRTC Calls. Returns Promise<void> addVideo() addVideo(): Promise<void> Add the VIDEO media to the current call. This feature can be used only if the "addVideo" call capability is 'True' and available only for WebRTC Calls. Returns Promise<void> answer() answer(withVideo?): Promise<void> Answer the current incoming call. This feature can be used only if the "answer" call capability is 'True'. By default, the answer is done with AUDIO only. If the 'withVideo' option is set to 'True' and the incoming call contains video, the answer will directly be done with audio and video. Parameters • withVideo?: boolean Option to answer the call directly with audio and video. Default value is 'False' Returns Promise<void> attachLocalSharingStream() attachLocalSharingStream(HtmlElementId): void Attach the local sharing stream to a given HTML VIDEO tag element; Parameters • HtmlElementId: string The ID of the HTML VIDEO tag element visible on the page Returns void attachLocalVideoStream() attachLocalVideoStream(HtmlElementId): void Attach the local video stream to a given HTML VIDEO tag element; Parameters • HtmlElementId: string The ID of the HTML VIDEO tag element visible on the page Returns void attachRemoteSharingStream() attachRemoteSharingStream(HtmlElementId): void Attach the remote sharing stream to a given HTML VIDEO tag element; Parameters • HtmlElementId: string The ID of the HTML VIDEO tag element visible on the page Returns void attachRemoteVideoStream() attachRemoteVideoStream(HtmlElementId): void Attach the remote video stream to a given HTML VIDEO tag element; Parameters • HtmlElementId: string The ID of the HTML VIDEO tag element visible on the page Returns void blindTransfer() blindTransfer(destination): Promise<void> Blind transfer the current call another destination which could be any rainbow user or phone number. A blind transfer is when you transfer a call directly to another party without consulting with the person receiving the call. In other words, there is no need to call the other party to make the transfer. This feature is available only if the connected user is behind a Rainbow Hub. Parameters • destination: CallDestination The destination of the blind transfer Returns Promise<void> deflectToPhoneNumber() deflectToPhoneNumber(number): Promise<void> Deflect (redirect) the current incoming call to the specified phone number. This feature can be used only if the "deflectToPhoneNumber" call capability is 'True'. The list of phone numbers where we can deflect the incoming call is available in the 'deflectPhoneNumberDestinations' call capability. Parameters • number: string The phone number the call will be deflected to. Returns Promise<void> deflectToVoicemail() deflectToVoicemail(): Promise<void> Deflect the current incoming call to the voice mail. This feature can be used only if the "deflectToVo

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationCallCapabilitiesLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / CallCapabilities Interface: CallCapabilities Call capabilities representing all the actions
content: DocumentationCallCapabilitiesLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / CallCapabilities Interface: CallCapabilities Call capabilities representing all the actions that could be done for the call given the state Properties addAudio readonly addAudio: boolean Indicates if we can add the audio media to the call. This could happen if there's no audio, for example in case of sharing only call. addParticipantsToCall readonly addParticipantsToCall: boolean Indicates if we can make a conference call from the current call by adding any other contact or number (that we dont have currently call with). This will remove the current call and create a web conference call instead. addSharing readonly addSharing: boolean Indicates if we can add the sharing media to the call. addVideo readonly addVideo: boolean Indicates if we can add the video media to the call. answer readonly answer: boolean Indicates if the incoming call can be answered. blindTransfer readonly blindTransfer: boolean Indicates if we can make a blind transfer of this call (transfer it to some other contact without having a call with them beforehand). This will remove the current call, and the other party will be transferred to the other contact / number. deflectPhoneNumberDestinations readonly deflectPhoneNumberDestinations: [Object?] The list of phone numbers where we can deflect the call deflectToPhoneNumber readonly deflectToPhoneNumber: boolean Indicates if we can deflect the incoming call to a phone number. The possible destinations numbers for call deflection are available in the 'deflectPhoneNumberDestinations' data. deflectToVoicemail readonly deflectToVoicemail: boolean Indicates if we can deflect the incoming call to the VoiceMail. Only available for HYBRID systems (for Cloud telephony, the release action will follow the system/user configuration) dtmf readonly dtmf: boolean Indicates if we can send dtmf for the call. hold readonly hold: boolean Indicates if we can put the call on hold. mergeCalls readonly mergeCalls: boolean Indicates if we can make a conference call from the current call and one other call in progress for the current user (can be used to merge the 2 calls). This will remove the 2 calls and create one single call (for hybride systems) or web conference. mute readonly mute: boolean Indicates if we can mute the call release readonly release: boolean Indicates if the call can be released / ended / declined. removeSharing readonly removeSharing: boolean Indicates if we can remove the sharing media from the call. removeVideo readonly removeVideo: boolean Indicates if we can remove the video media from the call. retrieve readonly retrieve: boolean Indicates if we can retrieve the call (if it is on hold). transferCallDestinations readonly transferCallDestinations: CallRB[] The list of calls where we can transfer this call; transferToOtherCall readonly transferToOtherCall: boolean Indicates if we can transfer the current call to the other call. If the call is on HOLD, then the tranfer is always made towards the ACTIVE call. Otherwise, we can transfer this call to any other call from the transferCallDestinations list. unmute readonly unmute: boolean Indicates if we can unmute the call Sur cette pagePropertiesaddAudioaddParticipantsToCalladdSharingaddVideoanswerblindTransferdeflectPhoneNumberDestinationsdeflectToPhoneNumberdeflectToVoicemaildtmfholdmergeCallsmutereleaseremoveSharingremoveVideoretrievetransferCallDestinationstransferToOtherCallunmuteCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

content: DocumentationCallDestinationLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / CallDestination Interface: CallDestination Data associated with the destination of a call. Properties country? optional country: string Phone number country. This information is only relevant if the destination is external. If not indicated, the caller's country is taken into account. phoneNumber? optional phoneNumber: string Phone number to be used for the call destination. This can be a telephone number associated with the Rainbow user profile. Or in the case of an external destination, a public PSTN number. user? optional user: User Peer object related to the Call destination. If the call destination is a Rainbow user, the object is an instance of User. excerpt: DocumentationCallServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / CallService Interface: CallService Description Call Service interface Methods makePhoneCall() mak
content: DocumentationCallServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Calls / CallService Interface: CallService Description Call Service interface Methods makePhoneCall() makePhoneCall(number, user?, additionalData?): Promise<void> Make a PBX Phone call towards a number A new conversation will be created if not existing already (even if it's with an external number) Parameters • number: string The number we want to call; The format could be anything the user can type, it will be transformed in E164 format. • user?: User A user to whom this number belongs to (in case of Rainbow User) • additionalData?: PhoneCallAdditionalData An additional data that can be send during the make call Returns Promise<void> makeWebCall() makeWebCall(user, medias?, message?): Promise<void> Make a standard WebRTC call toward a Rainbow user. A new conversation with the user will be created if not existing already. Parameters • user: User The user we want to call • medias?: MediaType[] Array containing the media to be used when setting up the new call By default, only the AUDIO media type will be added to the new call. • message?: string A complementary message send to the remote party informing about the reason of the call Returns Promise<void> mergeCalls() mergeCalls(): Promise<Conversation> Merge the current 2 calls into one single. This feature can be used only if the "mergeCalls" call capability is 'True'. In case of standard HYBRID conference, the return value is null. A new telephony conference (conversation with "conference" call) will be created. Otherwise, the result will be a web conference (in the form of a Rainbow bubble) that will be created in a new bubble conversation. Returns Promise<Conversation> Bubble Conversation with active web conference or null in case of hybrid 3-party conference call. subscribe() subscribe(callback, eventNames?): Subscription Subscribe to updates from the call service, all events are of RBEvent Parameters • callback The callback function that will be called when events are received • eventNames?: CallServiceEvents | CallServiceEvents[] (optional) array of event to listen Returns Subscription Returns RxJS Subscription Sur cette pageDescriptionMethodsmakePhoneCall()ParametersReturnsmakeWebCall()ParametersReturnsmergeCalls()Returnssubscribe()ParametersReturnsCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

content: DocumentationConnectionServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Connection / ConnectionService Interface: ConnectionService Methods getServer() getServer(): string Get the splatform server connection Returns string The server getState() getState(): ConnectionState Get the current connection state with the Rainbow Cloud Services Returns ConnectionState The connection state getToken() getToken(): string Get the current token associated with the connection Returns string The token logon() logon(login, password, rememberMe): Promise<ConnectedUser> Allow to sign-on to Rainbow from a user account that already exists. Parameters • login: string Rainbow hosted user login. • password: string Rainbow hosted user password. • rememberMe: boolean (default: false) When set to true, user token will be stored in local storage for further connections. Returns Promise<ConnectedUser> logonWithBubbleLink() logonWithBubbleLink(bubblelink, rememberMe?): Promise<ConnectedUser> Permits to log-on as "guest" in a bubble Parameters • bubblelink: string The bubble link. • rememberMe?: boolean when set to true, the auth token will be stored in localStorage for further connections. Returns Promise<ConnectedUser> logonWithToken() logonWithToken(token): Promise<ConnectedUser> Allow to sign-on with JWT token to Rainbow from a user account that already exists. Parameters • token: string Rainbow user existing JWT token. Returns Promise<ConnectedUser> logout() logout(): Promise<void> Allow to sign-on with JWT token to Rainbow from a user account that already exists. Returns Promise<void> A promise that resolve when user is log-out. setRenewedToken() setRenewedToken(token): Promise<void> Use this method to update the OAuth token which is being used. It is obligatory to update the token after each renewing. If the token is not renewed, an event AUTH_TOKEN_EXPIRE will be emitted and the user will be disconnected Parameters • token: string String representing the new AuthToken received after the renewing Returns Promise<void> A promise that resolve when token is renewed. start() start(): Promise<ConnectedUser> Allow to start the RainbowSDK. Returns Promise<ConnectedUser> a promise that resolve when RainbowSDK is started and ready to use. Return the authenticated contact if the autolog success. stop() stop(): Promise<void> Allow to stop the RainbowSDK. Returns Promise<void> a promise that resolve when RainbowSDK is stopped. subscribe() subscribe(handler, eventName?): Subscription Register a evenbt handler function for when the connectionService state change. Parameters • handler: ConnectionServiceEventHandler The handler function to register. • eventName?: string (optional) the name of the event to subscribe on. excerpt: DocumentationConversationEventsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationEvents Enumeration: ConversationEvents Conversation public events Even
content: DocumentationConversationEventsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationEvents Enumeration: ConversationEvents Conversation public events Events ON_MESSAGES_UPDATED ON_MESSAGES_UPDATED: "ON_MESSAGES_UPDATED" This RBEvent is send when something occurs on conversation messages ON_MESSAGE_ADDED ON_MESSAGE_ADDED: "ON_MESSAGE_ADDED" This RBEvent is send when a new message is added in this conversation ON_MESSAGE_BOOKMARKED ON_MESSAGE_BOOKMARKED: "ON_MESSAGE_BOOKMARKED" This RBEvent is send when a bookmark is set in this conversation ON_MESSAGE_CACHED ON_MESSAGE_CACHED: "ON_MESSAGE_CACHED" This RBEvent is send when a message is add in the "cache message". This "cache message" is used to store messages which belongs to the conversation but not already loaded. For example an old replied message. ON_MESSAGE_REPLACED ON_MESSAGE_REPLACED: "ON_MESSAGE_REPLACED" This RBEvent is send when the replaced/deleted message is the last one ON_MISSED_COUNTER_UPDATED ON_MISSED_COUNTER_UPDATED: "ON_MISSED_COUNTER_UPDATED" This RBEvent is send when the missed message counter is updated ON_STATUS_CHANGED ON_STATUS_CHANGED: "ON_STATUS_CHANGED" This RBEvent is send when the conversation status is changed This status represent the user typing activity. ACTIVE INACTIVE COMPOSING PAUSED RAINBOW_CONVERSATION_CALL_UPDATE RAINBOW_CONVERSATION_CALL_UPDATE: "RAINBOW_CONVERSATION_CALL_UPDATE" This RBEvent is send when In some situations when the call is "remotely picked" by another client and we update the tel call area (??) In some situations to manage the mute / unmute / sharing buttons in tell call area; This event is to be DELETED and replaced with something else; Sur cette pageEventsON_MESSAGES_UPDATEDON_MESSAGE_ADDEDON_MESSAGE_BOOKMARKEDON_MESSAGE_CACHEDON_MESSAGE_REPLACEDON_MISSED_COUNTER_UPDATEDON_STATUS_CHANGEDRAINBOW_CONVERSATION_CALL_UPDATECe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationConversationServiceEventsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationServiceEvents Enumeration: ConversationServiceEvents Events ON_
content: DocumentationConversationServiceEventsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationServiceEvents Enumeration: ConversationServiceEvents Events ON_ACTIVE_CALL_CHANGE ON_ACTIVE_CALL_CHANGE: "ON_ACTIVE_CALL_CHANGE" ON_ACTIVE_CALL_CHANGE Param [optional] The conversation where the call is now ACTIVE or RINGING_OUTGOING; COULD BE NULL if no call is active Param [optional] The call hat is now ACTIVE or RINGING_OUTGOING; COULD BE NULL if no call is active (the current call is no longer active) This RBEvent is send when there's update on the current active call; If no call is currently active, the event will be send with NO CONVERSATION AND NO CALL ON_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION_UPDATE ON_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION_UPDATE: "ON_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION_UPDATE" ON_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION_UPDATE Param The conversation related to the call (sometimes the converation will be null, as it has been deleted) Param The related call This RBEvent is send when there's updated in the call inside the conversation; For Telephony calls, the conversation could be null; ON_CONVERSATION_CREATED ON_CONVERSATION_CREATED: "ON_CONVERSATION_CREATED" ON_CONVERSATION_CREATED Param the new conversation This RBEvent is send when a conversation has been created from the user (or from another client) ON_CONVERSATION_REMOVED ON_CONVERSATION_REMOVED: "ON_CONVERSATION_REMOVED" ON_CONVERSATION_REMOVED Param the concerned conversation This RBEvent is send when a conversation has been removed from the user (or from another client) ON_MESSAGE_ADDED_IN_CONVERSATION ON_MESSAGE_ADDED_IN_CONVERSATION: "ON_MESSAGE_ADDED_IN_CONVERSATION" ON_MESSAGE_ADDED_IN_CONVERSATION Param The conversation where the message is being added This RBEvent is send when a new message is added to a conversation ON_MESSAGE_MODIFIED_IN_CONVERSATION ON_MESSAGE_MODIFIED_IN_CONVERSATION: "ON_MESSAGE_MODIFIED_IN_CONVERSATION" ON_MESSAGE_MODIFIED_IN_CONVERSATION Param The conversation where the message is being modified This RBEvent is send when a message is being modified (or deleted) in the conversation ON_NEW_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION ON_NEW_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION: "ON_NEW_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION" ON_NEW_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION Param The conversation to which the call is attached This RBEvent is send when a new call is added to the conversation; Could be used to manage the list of all conversations with calls ON_REMOVE_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION ON_REMOVE_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION: "ON_REMOVE_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION" ON_REMOVE_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION Param The conversation to which the call is removed This RBEvent is send when a new call is removed from the conversation; Could be used to manage the list of all conversations with calls ON_SERVICE_STARTED ON_SERVICE_STARTED: "ON_SERVICE_STARTED" This RBEvent is send when the conversation service is started and ready to be used (also fired after loss of network and reconnection) Sur cette pageEventsON_ACTIVE_CALL_CHANGEParamParamON_CALL_IN_CONVERSATION_UPDATEParamParamON_CONVERSATION_CREATEDParamON_CONVERSATION_REMOVEDParamON_MESSAGE_ADDED_IN_CONVERSATIONParamON_MESSAGE_MODIFIED_IN_CONVERSATIONParamON_NEW_CALL_IN_CONVERSATIONParamON_REMOVE_CALL_IN_CONVERSATIONParamON_SERVICE_STARTEDCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationWebv2 > lts > api > Conversations > interfaces > ConversationRainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / Conversation Interface: Conversation A conversation modelize an interaction b
content: DocumentationWebv2 > lts > api > Conversations > interfaces > ConversationRainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / Conversation Interface: Conversation A conversation modelize an interaction between one or more Rainbow users. In the Rainbow ecosystem we'll come across two types of conversations: The "peer-to-peer" (P2P) conversations : where two Rainbow users interact with each other. The "bubble" conversations : where several users interact all together. Properties bookmark bookmark: ConversationBookmark The bookmarked message in the conversation bubble? optional readonly bubble: Bubble (Bubble conversation only) The conversation Bubble if any call call: CallRB capabilities? optional readonly capabilities: ConversationCapabilities The capabilities of the conversation creationDate? optional readonly creationDate: Date The date of the creation of the conversation dbId? optional readonly dbId: string The database ID filterName readonly filterName: string The name of the conversation (the display name of the recipient for P2P conversation or the room name for a BUBBLE conversation) forwardedMessage readonly forwardedMessage: string The last message forwarded id readonly id: string The conversation ID isFavorite readonly isFavorite: boolean TRUE if conversation favorite isForwardedMessageFile readonly isForwardedMessageFile: boolean If the last message that is forwarded is a file isWebinarConversation readonly isWebinarConversation: boolean True if this conversation is a webinar conversation lastMessage readonly lastMessage: ConversationLastMessage The last message received of the conversation lastModification? optional readonly lastModification: Date The date of the last modification of the conversation messages readonly messages: Message[] The list of messages downloaded for this conversation missedCounter readonly missedCounter: number The number of instant messages not read name? optional readonly name: string The conversation name status readonly status: ConversationStatus The status of the conversation type? optional readonly type: ConversationType The type of the conversation. Can be P2P (0), BUBBLE (1) or BOT (2) user? optional readonly user: User (P2P conversation only) The recipient of the conversation webinar? optional readonly webinar: Webinar The webinar associated to this conversation (if any) Methods ackReadMessage() ackReadMessage(message): void This method permits to send a ACK READ status for message to mark it as READ Parameters • message: Message the chat message to "ACK read" Returns void ackReadMessages() ackReadMessages(): boolean This method permits to send a ACK READ all received messages inside the conversation Returns boolean deleteAllMessages() deleteAllMessages(): Promise<void> Remove all message of the conversation Returns Promise<void> deleteBookmark() deleteBookmark(): Promise<void> Method to delete a conversation bookmark Returns Promise<void> deleteMessage() deleteMessage(message): void Remove given message from the conversation (should be a message that the user has sent) Parameters • message: Message the message we want to delete Returns void forwardMessage() forwardMessage(destConv, message): Promise<Message> This method permits to forward a Message to another conversation Parameters • destConv: Conversation conversation to which the Message is forwarded • message: Message the message to forward Returns Promise<Message> getHistoryPage() getHistoryPage(nbMessages): Promise<void> This method allows us to retrieve archived message pages. By default, no message history is loaded, but this method will allow us to retrieve them page by page. Parameters • nbMessages: number the number of messages to get in this page Returns Promise<void> getMessageById() getMessageById(messId, searchInCache?): Message Return the message with the corresponding identifier Parameters • messId: string the message identifier • searchInCache?: boolean if true this methods start to search in cacheMessage Returns Message the search message if founded undefined else getMessages() getMessages(): Message[] Return all the already loaded messages Returns Message[] loadHistoryMessagesAroundGivenMessage() loadHistoryMessagesAroundGivenMessage(timestamp, nbMessages): Promise<void> Method used to load the messages around a given timestamp. Can be used when we search for a message via API searchForTextInConversation and then we want to load the message (or also the messages around it); This API will load the messages in the conversation list of messages and resolve once it's done; Parameters • timestamp: number the timestamp of the message to be loaded • nbMessages: number the number of messages to load before and after this one Returns Promise<void> modifyMessage() modifyMessage(message, newMessageText?, messageData?): Message This API can be used to modify an already existing sent message; The user is allowed to modify the text of the message, the additional content and the mentions; NB The new SendMessage

excerpt: DocumentationConversationServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationService Interface: ConversationService Methods getCallConversations()
content: DocumentationConversationServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Conversations / ConversationService Interface: ConversationService Methods getCallConversations() getCallConversations(): Conversation[] Get the array of all current call conversations, regardless of type (phone or webrtc) Returns Conversation[] getConversation() getConversation(convRef, type?): Promise<Conversation> Async method which get conversation for a bubble, a user or via conversation id. Conversation is first search in service cache then server side. Parameters • convRef: string | User | Bubble a bubble, a user or a conversation id • type?: "room" | "contact" the conversation type Returns Promise<Conversation> getConversations() getConversations(): Conversation[] Get the array of current conversations Returns Conversation[] globalSearch() globalSearch(searchedText, limit): Promise<SearchTextConvResults> Method used to search for text in all rooms and conversation. The searched text length should be 3+ characters. This API will return a list of all conversations / rooms with the number of occurances of the searched text in each one. If you need to get the results for a given conversation/room only, then use this API: searchForTextInConversation Parameters • searchedText: string the text to be searched in all conversations and rooms • limit: number the maximum number results to take. Default value is 500; Returns Promise<SearchTextConvResults> removeConversation() removeConversation(conversation): Promise<void> This method remove locally and server side a conversation; Should be used on conversations already created on server and not local ones Parameters • conversation: Conversation the conversation to remove Returns Promise<void> subscribe() subscribe(handler, eventNames?): Subscription Subscribe to updates from the service (all events are of RBEvent); Parameters • handler The call-back function that will be subscribed to the RxJS subject • eventNames?: ConversationServiceEvents | ConversationServiceEvents[] array of event to listen Returns Subscription Sur cette pageMethodsgetCallConversations()ReturnsgetConversation()ParametersReturnsgetConversations()ReturnsglobalSearch()ParametersReturnsremoveConversation()ParametersReturnssubscribe()ParametersReturnsCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationDirectorySearchOptionsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / DirectorySearch / DirectorySearchOptions Interface: DirectorySearchOptions List of options for
content: DocumentationDirectorySearchOptionsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / DirectorySearch / DirectorySearchOptions Interface: DirectorySearchOptions List of options for refining the search and specifying the results to be provided. Properties company? optional company: CompanyOptions Company filter to refine the search to include or exclude users/contacts of this company. Default value is null meaning that no company filter is specified. This option is only valid for searches in RAINBOW_USERS and RAINBOW_BUSINESS_CONTACTS_DIRECTORY directories. If the option is specified but not managed for the given directory type, it will be ignored. extendedMode? optional extendedMode: boolean Allows to search the user/contact on extended fields. [default value=false] Default value is false. In addition to the name-fields used by a "basic" search, an extended search will be carried out on addition fields such as the job title or the company name for example. The complete list of fields used in a extended search is described below. This extended search is only available to user having the feature SEARCH_BY_TAGS in their profile. If this option is set but the user does not have the feature SEARCH_BY_TAGS, the option is ignored and the search is performed in simple mode. Furthermore, a warning is logged. This option is managed differently depending on the directory type, as described below: RAINBOW_USERS_NETWORK: The extended search is not available. RAINBOW_USERS: This extended search applies on the following fields: firstName, lastName, company name, job title, department and tags. RAINBOW_BUSINESS_CONTACTS_DIRECTORY: This extended search applies on the following fields: firstName, lastName, company name, job title, department and tags. RAINBOW_PERSONAL_CONTACTS_DIRECTORY: This extended search applies on the following fields: firstName, lastName, company name, job title, department and tags. RAINBOW_PBX_USERS: The extended search is not available. MICROSOFT_O365_USERS: This extended search applies on the following fields: firstName, lastName, company name, job title and department. limit? optional limit: number The number of results to return. Limit value must be in range [1..100]. Default value is 20. If the value is not in the authorized range, the request will be rejected and an error logged. content: DocumentationDirectorySearchServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / DirectorySearch / DirectorySearchService Interface: DirectorySearchService Methods getAvailableDirectories() getAvailableDirectories(): DirectoryType[] This API returns the list of directories that can be used for a search by the logged-in user. Returns DirectoryType[] List of directories usable by the logged-in user. searchByName() searchByName(searchPattern, directory, options?): Promise<DirectorySearchResults> This API allows to search Rainbow users or contacts in a specified directory. It will finds a users/contacts that match a search criteria applied on names properties; depending on the type of directory. Search options can be specified for Managing the number of expected results. Activating the extended search mode. This mode allows to apply the search on more extensive names fields (than first and last names); depending on the type of directory. Refining the search the search by including an additional company criterion to include or exclude users/contacts of a company. This option is only available for certain directories. As a result, the search will return An array of results (as User model) depending on the number parameter. A flag indicating whether more results are available. Notes: A search always returns the first N results found. Results are not paginated, and it is not possible to specify an offset. The total number of results is not available. Parameters • searchPattern: string The search criteria • directory: DirectoryType The type of directory to be searched • options?: DirectorySearchOptions Options for refining the search and specifying the results to be provided. Returns Promise<DirectorySearchResults> Throws Error - In the event of a problem with the options supplied (e.g. their value) or encountered during query processing. excerpt: DocumentationFavoritesServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Favorites / FavoritesService Interface: FavoritesService Methods addToFavorites() addToFavorites(pee
content: DocumentationFavoritesServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / Favorites / FavoritesService Interface: FavoritesService Methods addToFavorites() addToFavorites(peerRef): Promise<void> Add the peer specified by its object to favorites list. The item is specified by its object instance (User or Bubble) and must be one of the following: A user, a bubble, a bot, a directory contact (from Personal Contacts or Business Contacts directories) or a Microsoft Azure AD user/Microsoft O365 contact. A ON_FAVORITE_CREATED event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about the favorite creation. Parameters • peerRef: User | Bubble Reference of the peer to add to favorites list. Returns Promise<void> deleteFavorite() deleteFavorite(id): Promise<void> Delete the favorite specified by its identifier. A ON_FAVORITE_DELETED event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about the favorite deletion. Parameters • id: string Favorite unique identifier. Returns Promise<void> deleteFromFavorites() deleteFromFavorites(peerRef): Promise<void> Remove a peer specified by its object reference from favorites list. A ON_FAVORITE_DELETED event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about the favorite deletion. Parameters • peerRef: User | Bubble Reference of the peer to remove from favorites list. Returns Promise<void> getFavorites() getFavorites(): Promise<Favorite[]> Get the complete list of my favorites with an array of Favorite. Returns Promise<Favorite[]> moveFavoritePosition() moveFavoritePosition(favorite, position): Promise<void> Move a favorite in the favorites list. The favorite specified by its object reference, is moved to the index specified in the parameter. In addition, all existing favorites from this index will also have their positions automatically shifted by 1. A ON_FAVORITES_ORDER_CHANGED event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about the favorite's move. Parameters • favorite: Favorite Reference of the favorite to move in the favorites list. • position: number The new position (starting from 0) of this favorite in the list. Returns Promise<void> subscribe() subscribe(callback, eventNames?): Subscription Subscribe to the favorites updates, all events are of RBEvent Parameters • callback The callback function that will be called when events are received • eventNames?: FavoritesServiceEvents | FavoritesServiceEvents[] (optional) array of event to listen Returns Subscription Returns RxJS Subscription Sur cette pageMethodsaddToFavorites()ParametersReturnsdeleteFavorite()ParametersReturnsdeleteFromFavorites()ParametersReturnsgetFavorites()ReturnsmoveFavoritePosition()ParametersReturnssubscribe()ParametersReturnsCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConnectedUserLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / User / ConnectedUser Interface: ConnectedUser This interface is used to represent a Rainbow user A User
content: DocumentationConnectedUserLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / User / ConnectedUser Interface: ConnectedUser This interface is used to represent a Rainbow user A User is defined by a set of public information (name, firstname, avatar...) and a set of private information that are only shared with contacts that are in the user's network or in the same company (email, phone numbers...) Extends User Properties adminType? optional adminType: string Inherited from User.adminType avatar? optional avatar: UserAvatar Inherited from User.avatar company? optional company: Company Inherited from User.company dbId dbId: string Inherited from User.dbId displayName? optional displayName: string Inherited from User.displayName firstname? optional firstname: string Inherited from User.firstname id id: string Inherited from User.id isBot isBot: boolean Inherited from User.isBot isTerminated isTerminated: boolean Inherited from User.isTerminated isTv isTv: boolean Inherited from User.isTv jid jid: string Inherited from User.jid jobTitle? optional jobTitle: string Inherited from User.jobTitle lastAvatarUpdateDate? optional lastAvatarUpdateDate: Date Inherited from User.lastAvatarUpdateDate lastname? optional lastname: string Inherited from User.lastname login login: string Inherited from User.login loginEmail? optional loginEmail: string Inherited from User.loginEmail phoneInternalNumber? optional phoneInternalNumber: string Inherited from User.phoneInternalNumber phoneNumbers? optional phoneNumbers: UserPhoneNumbers[] Inherited from User.phoneNumbers rainbowTvData rainbowTvData: any Inherited from User.rainbowTvData status status: string Inherited from User.status title? optional title: string Inherited from User.title Methods deleteAccount() deleteAccount(): Promise<void> Delete current user Account. This method deletes the connectedUser account and all its associated data. Depending on the configuration of the company hosting the connectedUser, this method may not work. Returns Promise<void> getAvailablePresenceStatusList() getAvailablePresenceStatusList(): string[] Return a list of status that the user can currently Set (via changeMyPresence API); Values are ['online', 'away', 'xa', 'dnd'] online: user goes to online (or can 'exit') any manual state; In case of a call in progress, the user will go to busy state; away: a manual Away state xa: 'invisble' or 'appear offline' manual state dnd: Do not disturb manual state Returns string[] Returns an array of all available values to be used if the user wants to change his presence getWebrtcAudioEnabled() getWebrtcAudioEnabled(): boolean Remove the current user custom avatar (reset to default avatar) Returns boolean isGuest() isGuest(): boolean Returns boolean Inherited from User.isGuest removeCustomAvatar() removeCustomAvatar(): Promise<User> Remove the current user custom avatar (reset to default avatar) Returns Promise<User> setCustomAvatar() setCustomAvatar(base64AvatarImg): Promise<User> Users have a default avatar generated from the initials of their first and/or last names. Ex: User John Do, will have the default avatar : JD. But this avatar can be overloaded by an image chosen by the user Parameters • base64AvatarImg: string Base64 image to be uploaded Returns Promise<User> setPresenceStatus() setPresenceStatus(status): void Set the current user presence status (if allowed); The status list can be get at all time via computeStatusList Parameters • status: string The presence status that the user wants to set to his user. The status list can be get via computeStatusList API Returns void subscribe() subscribe(handler, filterEvent?): Subscription Subscribe to updates on the current contact (all events are of RBEvent type {name: string, data:any}); Parameters • handler: any The call-back function that will be subscribed to the RxJS subject • filterEvent?: string[] A list of event names that the user wants to receive when subscribing (used a filter) Returns Subscription Inherited from User.subscribe toJSON() toJSON(): any Returns any Inherited from User.toJSON updateCustomData() updateCustomData(customData): Promise<User> Update the user's custom data (emergencyImSound, enablePushToTalkTone, guideTourDisplayed, etc...) Parameters • customData: Record<string, string> to be send to the server for update Returns Promise<User> updatePassword() updatePassword(oldPassword, newPassword, async): Promise<User> Update the user's password Parameters • oldPassword: string the old password • newPassword: string the new password • async: boolean if TRUE, the resolve of this API will be done once the change is taken into account also on XMPP side; Default value is FALSE Returns Promise<User> updateProfile() updateProfile(userProfile): Promise<User> Update the user's profile data (name, emails, numbers, etc) Parameters • userProfile: UserProfile the userProfile to be send to the server for update Returns Promise<User> Sur cette pageExtendsPropertiesadminType?

excerpt: DocumentationUserProfileLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / User / UserProfile Interface: UserProfile Properties country? optional country: string country: User coun
content: DocumentationUserProfileLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / User / UserProfile Interface: UserProfile Properties country? optional country: string country: User country (ISO 3166-1 alpha3 format) customData? optional customData: Record<string, string> User's custom data. Object with free keys/values. It is up to the client to manage the user's customData (new customData provided overwrite the existing one). Restrictions on customData Object: max 20 keys, max key length: 64 cON_DIAL_IN_PHONENUMBER_UPDATEharacters, max value length: 4096 characters. emails? optional emails: any[] Array of emails object (check example in the interface UserUpdateData) firstName? optional firstName: string User first name guestMode? optional guestMode: boolean guestMode: If the user is in a guest mode isInitialized? optional isInitialized: boolean isInitialized: If the user has been initialized jobTitle? optional jobTitle: string User job title language? optional language: string Language format is composed of locale using format ISO 639-1, with optionally the regional variation using ISO 3166‑1 alpha-2 (separated by hyphen). Locale part is in lowercase, regional part is in uppercase. Examples: en, en-US, fr, fr-FR, fr-CA, es-ES, es-MX, ... lastName? optional lastName: string User last name nickName? optional nickName: string User nickname phoneNumbers? optional phoneNumbers: any[] Array of phone numbers object (check example in the interface UserUpdateData) Notes: If not phoneNumbers is provided, this will not update the current list; Provided PhoneNumbers data overwrite previous values: PhoneNumbers which are not known on server side are added, PhoneNumbers which are changed are updated, PhoneNumbers which are not provided but existed on server side are deleted. title? optional title: string User title Sur cette pagePropertiescountry?customData?emails?firstName?guestMode?isInitialized?jobTitle?language?lastName?nickName?phoneNumbers?title?Ce contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

content: DocumentationUserNetworkServiceEventsLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / UserNetwork / UserNetworkServiceEvents Enumeration: UserNetworkServiceEvents Events RAINBOW_ON_INVITATIONS_LIST_UPDATED RAINBOW_ON_INVITATIONS_LIST_UPDATED: "RAINBOW_ON_INVITATIONS_LIST_UPDATED" This RBEvent is send when the invitation list (received/send) is updated RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_ACCEPTED RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_ACCEPTED: "RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_ACCEPTED" This RBEvent is send when the invitation (from / to) contact is accepted with data {invitation:Invitation, user:User} RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_RECEIVED RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_RECEIVED: "RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_RECEIVED" This RBEvent is send when a new network invitation is received from another Rainbow user with data {invitation:Invitation, user:User} Sur cette pageEventsRAINBOW_ON_INVITATIONS_LIST_UPDATEDRAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_ACCEPTEDRAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_RECEIVEDCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationUserNetworkServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / UserNetwork / UserNetworkService Interface: UserNetworkService Methods acceptInvitation() acceptIn
content: DocumentationUserNetworkServiceLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / UserNetwork / UserNetworkService Interface: UserNetworkService Methods acceptInvitation() acceptInvitation(invitation): Promise<void> API used to accept a received invitation (which is not accepted or rejected yet) Parameters • invitation: NetworkInvitation The received invitation that we want to accept Returns Promise<void> cancelInvitation() cancelInvitation(invitation): Promise<void> API used to cancel a send invitation (which is not accepted yet) Parameters • invitation: NetworkInvitation The invitation that we want to cancel Returns Promise<void> declineInvitation() declineInvitation(invitation): Promise<void> API used to decline a received invitation (which is not accepted or rejected yet) Parameters • invitation: NetworkInvitation The received invitation that we want to decline Returns Promise<void> getReceivedInvitations() getReceivedInvitations(): NetworkInvitation[] Returns the list of received invitations for this user Returns NetworkInvitation[] getSentInvitations() getSentInvitations(): NetworkInvitation[] Returns the list of send invitations Returns NetworkInvitation[] getUsers() getUsers(includePersonnalDirectoryUsers?): User[] Returns a list of users that are in the network of the connected user Parameters • includePersonnalDirectoryUsers?: boolean f true, the API will return all users in the user's network including all his personnal directory contacts Returns User[] an array of users found or an empty array if no user has been found reSendInvitation() reSendInvitation(invitation): Promise<void> API used to resend an invitations Parameters • invitation: NetworkInvitation The invitation to resend Returns Promise<void> removeUser() removeUser(user): Promise<void> Remove given user from our network. This means that the user will no longer receive any presence updates for this user etc. Parameters • user: User the contact to be removed from our network Returns Promise<void> sendBulkInvitations() sendBulkInvitations(emails): Promise<void> API used to send invitations to list of emails; Limit is 100 emails Parameters • emails: string[] The list of emails to send the invitations; Limit is 100 emails Returns Promise<void> sendInvitation() sendInvitation(user, customMessage?): Promise<void> API used to invite a Rainbow user to join our network. In the case of same company, the invitation will be auto-accepted by the distant; In case of different companies, this will send an invitation and email to the distant user; This API will send an 'update' event on the contact object Parameters • user: User The rainbow user to invite • customMessage?: string A custom message that will be send to the distant user via email Returns Promise<void> sendInvitationByEmail() sendInvitationByEmail(email, customMessage?): Promise<void> API used to send invitation to join rainbow to an email. Parameters • email: string The email to send the invitation • customMessage?: string A custom message that will be send to the distant user via email Returns Promise<void> subscribe() subscribe(handler, eventNames?): Subscription Subscribe to the invitations updates; All events send to the callback are of type RB Event Events that will be received in the subscribe : 'RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_RECEIVED' with data {invitation:Invitation, contact:Contact}: A new invitation from 'contact' is received 'RAINBOW_ON_INVITATION_ACCEPTED' with data {invitation:Invitation, contact:Contact}: The invitation (from / to) contact is accepted 'RAINBOW_ON_INVITATIONS_LIST_UPDATED' with no data: The invitation list (received/send) is updated Parameters • handler The callback function that will be called when events are received • eventNames?: UserNetworkServiceEvents | UserNetworkServiceEvents[] EventName, or list of EventName to subscribe to Returns Subscription Sur cette pageMethodsacceptInvitation()ParametersReturnscancelInvitation()ParametersReturnsdeclineInvitation()ParametersReturnsgetReceivedInvitations()ReturnsgetSentInvitations()ReturnsgetUsers()ParametersReturnsreSendInvitation()ParametersReturnsremoveUser()ParametersReturnssendBulkInvitations()ParametersReturnssendInvitation()ParametersReturnssendInvitationByEmail()ParametersReturnssubscribe()ParametersReturnsCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur

excerpt: DocumentationUsersListLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / UsersLists / UsersList Interface: UsersList Properties description description: string Description of the u
content: DocumentationUsersListLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Rainbow SDK • Docs Rainbow SDK / UsersLists / UsersList Interface: UsersList Properties description description: string Description of the users list id readonly id: string Unique identifier of the users list isFavorite isFavorite: boolean Data indicating whether the list has been marked as favorite or not. name name: string Name of the users list users readonly users: User[] User(s) members of the list Methods addUser() addUser(user): Promise<any> Add a user in the list. A ON_USER_ADDED_TO_LIST event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about adding the user to the list. Parameters • user: User The user to add to users list Returns Promise<any> removeUser() removeUser(user): Promise<any> Remove a user from the list. A ON_USER_REMOVED_FROM_LIST event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about removing a user from the list. Parameters • user: User Reference of the user to remove from the list Returns Promise<any> updateProfile() updateProfile(profile): Promise<any> Update the profile of the users list. Only the general information, i.e. the name, the description and the favorite status can be updated using this method. Users can only be added or removed from the list using methods 'addUser' and 'removeUser' respectively. A ON_USERS_LIST_PROFILE_UPDATED event is sent afterwards at the completion of the operation to notify about the list's profile update. title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConfigureLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Configure SDK We now have a functional buildline and project, we need to configure and start the SDK framework. Before we can use the SDK, w
content: DocumentationConfigureLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Configure SDK We now have a functional buildline and project, we need to configure and start the SDK framework. Before we can use the SDK, we need to create/declare our application in the Rainbow ecosystem. In this guide, for the moment, we simply want to create a test application. Rainbow offers a working platform dedicated to this kind of application: the sandbox platform. Let's see how to create such an application. 😱 Painful stage This part is a bit long and tedious but don't worry, we'll guide you through it and you only have to do it once. Step 1: Create a user account on rainbow If you're reading this guide, you probably already have a Rainbow user account. If not, please create one here: Create a Rainbow account Step 2: Log-on the developpers site and register as developper With your Rainbow credentials, log on to the developers website If this is the first time you've logged on, or if you haven't done so yet, you will be asked to register as a developer. Thank you for completing this process. Congratulation: You are now register as Rainbow developper, welcome to our familly Step 3: Create your sandbox environment It's now time to create your sandbox environment. To do this, on the developer site, in the left-hand menu, click on the sandbox entry. You will receive your sandbox credentials by e-mail, please check your e-mails Sandbox Rainbow URL: https://web-sandbox.openrainbow.com Your developer account : your@email.com Your developper password : xxxxxxxxxx Sandbox APIs address: https://openrainbow.com Step 4: Connect to the developper sandbox site If you go back to the "developpers" site, in the sandbox section, you can now connect by clicking on the small icon at the top right of the right-hand panel 😖 You need to log in using the password you received in your e-mail! Once you've done this, you should (finally) see the sandbox application creation menu appear 😥 Step 5: Create your test application Click on the "Create application" button to create your sandBox application You will be redirected to your new application settings page. 🧭 INFORMATION This is where you'll find all the information we need to configure our SDK, in particular the applicationID and the secretKey. To use the SDK you need an applicationID and a secretKey. These information allow you to identify your application and to use the Rainbow platform. For more information, see Applications lifecycle which explains what is the purpose, how to create an application and how to get the applicationID and the secretKey. The serverHostname is also necessary to know which server is used in our case and for the moment the sandbox. In the sandbox case, the serverHostname is 'sandbox.openrainbow.com' Step 6: Configure the SDK First, we have to create an instance of the Rainbow SDK in our test application. To do this we will modify the index.ts file: import { RainbowSDK } from 'rainbow-web-sdk'; class TestApplication { protected rainbowSDK: RainbowSDK; constructor() { this.rainbowSDK = RainbowSDK.create({ appConfig: { server: 'serverHostname', applicationId: 'applicationId', secretKey: 'secretKey' }, plugins: [], autoLogin: true, logLevel: LogLevelEnum.WARNING }); } } const testApplication = new TestApplication(); We pass the following object to the RainbowSDK { appConfig: { server: 'serverHostname', applicationId: 'applicationId', secretKey: 'secretKey' }, plugins: [], autoLogin: true, logLevel: LogLevelEnum.WARNING } This will configure our SDK object with our application information: appConfig: serverHostname is the server used, in our case: "sandbox.openrainbow.com". applicationId and secretKey are your credentials created in step 5. plugins is an array that will allow you to add features to our SDK through a plugin mechanism. This mechanism will embed and start only the necessary features (and not a whole bunch of useless functionalities). autologin specifies if the SDK will try to automatically connect to the server if an existing auth token is found locally. logLevel specifies the logLevel. 💡 Tips The RainbowSDK is the entry point of the SDK and is a singleton object: it will be created only once ! If you need to get this singleton anywhere in your application, just use the static getInstance() method: this.rainbowSDK = RainbowSDK.getInstance(); Step 7: Start your app It is now time to start your app and check if the RainbowSDK is well loaded and started ! $ npm run build $ npm run serve PMA: LOPACOMPRI Then reload you browser and this the expected result You can check the state of the Rainbow SDK from the console. Continue to Connection Sur cette pageStep 1: Create a user account on rainbowStep 2: Log-on the developpers site and register as developperStep 3: Create your sandbox environmentStep 4: Connect to the developper sandbox siteStep 5: Create your test applicationStep 6: Configure the SDKStep 7: Start your appCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyrigh

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationConnectionLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Create and connect user Now that Rainbow is alive in our application we have to try to authenticate a user. We already have a user on the S
content: DocumentationConnectionLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Create and connect user Now that Rainbow is alive in our application we have to try to authenticate a user. We already have a user on the SandBox platform: you! But let's see how to quickly create test users. Two important pieces of information: When you have created your developer account on sandbox, the user that has been created has administrative rights. That is to say that it has the possibility of creating Rainbow users manually. Moreover, in Rainbow, users are attached to a company. When your user was created, a company was also created. We are going to create our test users in this company! 😱 Another tedious step But as previously, just do do once ! Step 1: Access the Rainbow administration interface First, connect to the SandBox platform (step 4 of the previous guide). Remember, you have to use the login/password you have received via e-mail And reach the following site: Connect to the SandBox platform Once connected click on this icon on the Rainbow left action bar: (It's not obvious but it is the administration icon 😁). This will open the Rainbow administration interface: specifically, your company dashboard! Click on the to access the administration of your company and its users. Finally click on the members icon You now see the list of members of your company appear, which at this stage should only contain one member: you! The button at the top right of this list allows you to create users. To save time, we invite you to immediately create 3 users who will be useful to us later: Alice, Bob and Carole. 💡 NOTE When creating a user you will be asked for an email address. It is not necessary for these three users to have "real" email addresses, so you can invent one (no confirmation email sent).Likewise, no matter what names you give them, just know that in the rest of this guide, we will identify them by Alice, Bob and Carole Step 2: Connect SDK with Alice How to proceed ? The rainbowSDK object carries the connection object which handles all Rainbow connection stuff (it manages connection/disconnection, network loss/retrival, ...) First, we will add a listener to this connection object // Subscribe to connection object events (only RAINBOW_ON_CONNECTION_STATE_CHANGE events) this.rainbowSDK.connection.subscribe((event: RBEvent) => { this.connectionStateChangeHandler(event); }, ConnectionServiceEvents.RAINBOW_ON_CONNECTION_STATE_CHANGE); // Declare a simple event handler (just log events in the console) private connectionStateChangeHandler(event: RBEvent): void { const connectionState: ConnectionState = event.data; console.info(`[testAppli] onConnectionStateChange ${connectionState.state} ${connectionState.reason}`); } With this code, we can now be informed of the rainbow connection status. Now we will try to authenticate on the Rainbow platform. To do this, we're going to use the this.rainbowSDK.start method. This return the connected user when connection success. If the connection fails, then call the this.rainbowSDK.connectionService.logon with the previous credentials. Suppose that Alice has as for login (her email address) and password the following information: login: 'alice.test@drabedroc.fr' password: 'AlicePassword' let userConnected: ConnectedUser = await this.rainbowSDK.start(); if (!userConnected) { try { userConnected = await this.rainbowSDK.connectionService.logon('alice.test@drabedroc.fr', 'AlicePassword', true); } catch (error: any) { this.rainbowSDK.logger.error(`[testAppli] ${error.message}`); return; } } console.info(`[testAppli] connected with user ${userConnected.displayName}`); All together now: import { ConnectionServiceEvents, ConnectionState, ConnectedUser, RBEvent, RainbowSDK } from 'rainbow-sdk'; class TestRainbowSDK { protected rainbowSDK: RainbowSDK; public async init(): Promise<void> { this.rainbowSDK = RainbowSDK.create({ appConfig: { server: 'sandbox.openrainbow.com', applicationId: 'yourApplicationId', secretKey: 'yourSecretKey' }, plugins: [], autoLogin: true, logLevel: LogLevelEnum.WARNING }); this.rainbowSDK.connectionService.subscribe((event: RBEvent) => this.connectionStateChangeHandler(event), ConnectionServiceEvents.RAINBOW_ON_CONNECTION_STATE_CHANGE); let userConnected: ConnectedUser = await this.rainbowSDK.start(); if (!userConnected) { try { userConnected = await this.rainbowSDK.connectionService.logon('alice.test@drabedroc.fr', 'AlicePassword!', true); } catch (error: any) { console.error(`[testAppli] ${error.message}`); return; } } console.info(`[testAppli] connected with user ${userConnected.displayName}`); } private connectionStateChangeHandler(event: RBEvent): void { const connectionState: ConnectionState = event.data; console.info(`[testAppli] onConnectionStateChange ${connectionState.state}`); } } const testRainbowSDK = new TestRainbowSDK(); testRainbowSDK.init(); And now check the results Congratulation, your application is now connected to Rainbow with the user 'alice.test@drabedroc.fr

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationInstallationLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Install SDK Requirements Before you start using Rainbow Web SDK, you need to make sure you have installed the required software tools. -
content: DocumentationInstallationLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Install SDK Requirements Before you start using Rainbow Web SDK, you need to make sure you have installed the required software tools. - Node.js and NPM: Make sure you have installed Node.js version 18.18.2 or above. $ node --version v18.18.2 💡 Tips You can use nvm for managing multiple Node versions on a single machine installed. - A big browser: We will be use Chrome browser to develop (best debug tools), but you can use any of the browsers supported by Rainbow Web SDK. - A clever text editor: Rainbow Web SDK is a JavaScript library, therefore you can use any text editor or IDE to develop your first project (but our favorite editor is Microsoft Visual Studio Code). Create your web application As mentioned above, the project is going to use the structure of a simple JavaScript application. We will need a basic HTML structure that would load all the necessary libraries. Go on and create a new folder. We recommend using command line tools. Open a shell console and execute the following commands: $ mkdir myFirstRainbowProject $ cd myFirstRainbowProject $ npm init -y Once finished, you should have your JSON file package.json filled with the information. This step is required to install the mandatory NPM libraries. Patch your package.json To allow your project to load ES modules you have to patch the newly created package.json Just add the line "type": "module", { "name": "myfirstrainbowproject", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "", "main": "index.js", "type": "module", "scripts": { "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1" }, "keywords": [], "author": "", "license": "ISC" } Install and configure a module bundler : Rollup Our SDK is delivered as an EcmaScript Module (ESM), to unleash the full power of ESM module you have to use a module bundler to bundle your application. In this example we will use the Rollup module bundler, but you are free to use any modern module bundler (webpack is also a good candidate for example). Rollup is easy to use and configure! 🤔 According to their authors: Rollup is a module bundler for JavaScript which compiles small pieces of code into something larger and more complex, such as a library or application. It uses the new standardized format for code modules included in the ES6 revision of JavaScript, instead of previous idiosyncratic solutions such as CommonJS and AMD. ES modules let you freely and seamlessly combine the most useful individual functions from your favorite libraries. So, it's easy! Let's install Rollup: $ npm install rollup --global $ npm install rollup-plugin-typescript2 --save-dev $ npm install @rollup/plugin-node-resolve --save-dev $ npm install serve --save-dev $ npm install rollup-plugin-copy --save-dev With the previous commands we have installed: The Rollup bundler The typescript Rollup plugin (Because we are in 2024 and that we refuse to code in JS 😅) The node Rollup plugin (To permit bundle to access the libraries stored in the node_modules directory) The mini HTTP server (serve) that we'll use to serve our application The Rollup copy plugin to copy static files in dist directory Now add the Rollup config file at the root of the project rollup.config.js: import typescript from "rollup-plugin-typescript2"; import copy from 'rollup-plugin-copy'; import nodeResolve from '@rollup/plugin-node-resolve'; const config = [ { input: './src/index.ts', output: { file: './dist/index.js', format: 'esm', sourcemap: 'true' }, plugins: [ nodeResolve(), typescript({ useTsconfigDeclarationDir: false }), copy({targets: [{ src: ['./src/index.html'], dest: './dist' }]}) ] } ]; export default config; Open your package.json file and add the "build" and "serve" line in you script entry "scripts": { "build": "rollup -c rollup.config.js", "serve": "serve ./dist", } The "build" command will execute the Rollup bundler. The "serve" command will start a local HTTP server on your computer to serve our test application. ** Finally add a minimal tsconfig.json configuration file { "compilerOptions": { "module": "ESNext", "target": "es2019", "moduleResolution": "node" } } Install the Rainbow Web SDK Now, it's time to install the Rainbow Web SDK library. The SDK for Web is available as an NPM package to make the installation and updates easier. To install it, execute the following command at the root of your project. $ npm install rainbow-web-sdk@5.0.0-beta.3 The Rainbow Web SDK has been added to your folder node_modules. This folder contains all the packages installed from NPM. Create the index.html and index.ts root files First create the src directory (make sure you navigate to your project folder first): $ mkdir src And then put these two files in the newly created src directory: index.html: <html> <head> <!-- 🤔 Note: in the next line .js extension is not a typo --> <script type="module" src="./index.js"></script> </head> <body> It works !! </body> </html> index.ts: import { RainbowSDK } from 'rainbow-web-sd

title: CPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow
excerpt: DocumentationGetting StartedLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Getting started with the Rainbow Web SDK v2 Welcome We are pleased to present our (new) Rainbow Web Software Development Kit (SDK) for
content: DocumentationGetting StartedLTS release 5.0.0Publiée le 2024-06-22Getting started with the Rainbow Web SDK v2 Welcome We are pleased to present our (new) Rainbow Web Software Development Kit (SDK) for the Rainbow platform. It's a total rewriting from Rainbow SDK v1, taking advantage of new technologies and with a completely modernized toolchain. With this SDK you have the potential to build your own social network, your own banking, hospitality or whatever app you want with audio and video as well as multi-party chat interactions between your users just by importing this library to your app! Take time to read this first tutorial to understand the basics and then deploy your imagination and your coding spirit to build your app! A new SDK for the Rainbow platform? But why? Wasn't the old SDK great? Well, no! The old Rainbow SDK wasn't all that great! It had some serious drawbacks: No ESM support: SDK v1 is only distributed as a CommonJS library, when building an application with the SDK v1 your need to embeed the complete library. No TypeScript support: the SDK v1 was a pure Vanilla JS library, no type were provided. Not framework agnostic: the SDK v1 was based on the angularJS framework, and you have to embedded angularJS in your project event if you don't use it. Poor API design and documentation: the SDK v1 API are often difficult to use and to understand. 😖 WARNING After v2's official release, we highly encourage you to use Rainbow SDK v2 rather than Rainbow SDK v1, as Rainbow SDK v1 will be deprecated. If you've already developped an application with SDK v1, the migration strategy will be explain here. Now it's time to getting started Getting started with Rainbow Web SDK could not be easier. By adding a single line to your existing JavaScript project, you will have access to the public API of the Rainbow Cloud Services. This guide explains how to set up your Rainbow SDK v2 project. It includes information on prerequisites, installing, and optionally starting a sample example in your application to verify your setup. Can't wait to find out, let's go Sur cette pageWelcomeA new SDK for the Rainbow platform?Now it's time to getting startedCe contenu vous a-t-il été utile ?OuiNonFeedback© Copyright - 2022 | ALE InternationalCPaaS SDK for business communication solutions | Rainbow v2.31.0ProduitsWebNodeAndroidiOSReact NativeCSharpAPIsLiens utilesDocumentationStoreSupportTarifsAccueilExploreMentions légalesContrat de servicesContrat de développeurPolitique de cookiesLogiciels tiersEntreprisePartenairesNous visiterRainbowNous contacterSuivez-nous sur
